Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for UMMC Access”
Reviews.Author: herekittyOhio
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I just spent 2 nights at the Days Inn visiting her son at the University of Maryland Medical Center. We were concerned about having to drive in Baltimore and the logistics of getting to and from the hospital since she is in a walker/wheelchair. Once we got parked, we never had to move the car. The front desk calls a free shuttle service provided by UMMC and they deliver you to and from the hospital. And, if you call the hotel to make the reservation, they give a special rate to family members visiting patients. The gentlemen at the front door and the lobby were terrific. They always helped with the chair and steps and gave great tips for all the questions we asked. We ate at the restaurant a couple of times, and it was satisfactory. The room was fine - nothing special but very clean with a refrigerator and microwave. Everything we needed. The bedding was wonderful and we slept well. We did venture a few blocks to eat at a recommended restaurant and had no problems. It seems centrally located to all the tourist attractions. One tip I can offer is about parking if you are using the Days Inn as your "home" while visiting the hospital. It costs $23 to park at the hotel while the parking garage at the hospital is only $6 and you can use it 24 hours. Park at the hospital then use the shuttle to take you back to the hotel. Our shuttle driver even took one guest back to the garage, drove in and found her car and dropped her off. Wish we had known this earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly staff, top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: Audrey545
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently took a trip to Baltimore for a volleyball tournament. We stayed at the Days Inn Inner Harbor Baltimore, MD and got in around 10:30pm on a Thursday evening. As soon as we pulled up to the front lobby, there was a gentleman who was already at our car with a dolly to grab our bags and take them in. He was the friendliest person and took very good care of our bags. He asked us where we were from and wished us luck with the tournament. Then we asked the front desk about local bars to get a drink and they were so helpful. They even walked us outside to show us where to go...at almost 11 o'clock at night! Every day we went by the lobby there was someone to greet us and tell us to have a great day. We went to the hotel restaurant for dinner one night and the food was delicious. The cafe was wonderful and again, the woman who worked there remembered what we drank- the chai tea with vanilla was very good. I don't normally write reviews for places I go but I just could not help writing a review for this hotel. Extremely friendly and helpful staff go a long way... excellent job Days Inn Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice !”
Reviews.Author: zozobear
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are looking to catch a baseball game. Before my stay I was concerned about the safety of the walk back to the hotel after a night game but no need to worry. There were so many other fans walking in that direction with us that I didn't even give it a second thought. I don't think the walk took more than five minutes either. The room was clean and comfortable. Just a short walk to the harbor too. The only downside I could find was the operation of the elevators , It is something they should address.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean, Quiet, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sbjjill
Reviews.Content: Location is adjacent to Convention Center & Mariners Arena and two blocks or so from Inner Harbor. Clean and comfortable rooms (although down pillows would be better), decent dining room, nice staff. Front desk staff need more training (please explain the parking pass particulars better! We had to run back into the hotel on two occasions to fix our ticket to get out of the lot.) Parking isn't cheap -- $23/day but at least there's no hotel fees on that.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Just a note to let anyone know that is going to the Inner Harbor to check this facility out. I have stayed at this hotel only a couple times, but all have been FABULOUS! The rooms are nice and very convenient to a lot to do, especially the convention center. Most important is the service! From the front desk to the support staff. I have worked with the reservations and accounting people and they are great! Thanks to Will, Jessica, and Katherine! They really do a great job and are very pleasant to work with. John R.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location for this price, but don't count on a wake up call”
Reviews.Author: WishIC0uldTravelM0re
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from everything fun in Baltimore, which is great. Restaurant in the hotel is nice but a little pricey. Room was good enough, but not the best. They need to invest in some Febreeze, because the room smelled a little funny every time we walked in. Stayed 3 nights - never got wake up call first morning and it was late the next two mornings. Only use it as your back up if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “What A Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BruceH09
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a quick conference and had traveled 30+ hours to get to Baltimore and the Days Inn. I was expecting just a so so bed and a basic room - WRONG! We were met with friendly faces, helpful staff and a beautiful lobby. The room was fantastic - nice beds, great facilities and space! The all you can eat breakfast is great value for under $12, including juices, coffee, cereals and cooked items. The free wi-fi also extends to your room - not just the public spaces as listed - another bonus. All this for a fantastic rate. THANK YOU to the staff at the Days Inn - happy to recommend you.

Reviews.Title: “Standing ovation for the staff of Days Inn Inner Harbor Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Ajs_oz
Reviews.Content: Business trip - 3 day stay. We got a great rate, comfortable, clean room, a breakfast buffet of amazing value. Free photocopying from the business center. Free wifi everywhere. Really, this was one of the most comfortable stays I've had. The jewel in the crown was the staff. From the cleaning staff to the front desk and restaurant staff, nothing was too hard and there were plenty of smiles being flashed around. If you ever get to read this, thank you for excellent service from some weary travellers far from home.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced room, great stay”
Reviews.Author: xilex
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for one night for an interview near the medical center. Booked for a very low price with hotels.com. There is nothing extravagant about the room, but it provided all the necessary amenities for a good stay. Plenty of towels and supplies, room was very clean, and the wireless internet was actually working. I did read a bedbug report at this hotel on another website in a room one floor below mine, and was slightly scared to sleep that night, but I made it out with no bedbugs or bites. Had a good night sleep, very quiet. Very nice staff in the hotel. I had to hang out in the lobby for several hours before leaving and they never bothered me about it and let me keep my laptop plugged in. Additionally, it's located near many walkable restaurants, small shops (CVS, etc), so if you need something, you can walk there. Overall, this is good for a value-stay, clean living space, quiet night, sufficient towels and amenities. It's not a 5-star room, but it's also not a dirty motel room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, nice room in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: knoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great service and the room was clean and comfy. It is located right by Pratt Strett and it was 20 dollars cheaper per night than any other hotel in the Inner Harbor. Parking is reasonable as well at 23 bucks a day. You don't find much better than that in downtown Bmore. My only complaints are that there is no free breakfast and the hotel bar/restaurant closes at 10, which is too early. Thanks for a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Above the norm. Surprizingly great value.”
Reviews.Author: iamrennie
Reviews.Content: For a Days Inn, this place is really impressive. Clean, well-maintained lobby & rooms, w/ a friendly support staff. Modern design. Parking deck adjacent. Restaurant had good value (read: moderate fare, inexpensive price). Location is great for a walk to inner harbor, convention center, ball parks. Short cab ride to Fells Point. Great deal for one or multiple night stays. Don't be turned off by the "Days Inn" moniker. It's nothing like any Days Inn I've ever seen. Book this baby!

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Hestika
Reviews.Content: Great location and price. Room is nice and friendly staff. Can't beat it if you are staying a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Cecpet
Reviews.Content: If I could I would give the hotel a 3.5 since it is better than average but it wouldn´t describe it as very good. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the renovated rooms are a nice mixture of cosy and modern and the fitness center has most things you need. I appriciated the complimentary water and snacks that was refilled daily. The down side is that the resturant isn´t more than ok, they have very reasonable prices so if you are just hungry thats fine, and the rooms are not very sound proof, I could here everything from the hallway. Over all I was happy with my stay, good value for money and close to my conferance at the Hilton and shopping in the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel and price”
Reviews.Author: cvandenbraak
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at Days Inn for a conference at the convention center. I am a little skeptical about Days Inn due to previous experiences. However this one was just as good as any Hilton hotel. Checkin was friendly and quick, room was clean and nice fitness center. I ate breakfast in the hotel and it was very good also. Would definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff at Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly M
Reviews.Content: My car broke down outside of this Days Inn. I went inside to ask for some help and the front desk help was amazingly kind and helpful. While I was waiting for the hotel's engineer to meet me in the lobby, the front desk staff told me (and my friend) to make ourselves comfortable in the lobby and use the restroom, etc. as needed. I heard them answer a phone call and they kindly explained to the person on the other end that they have a lost and found and could send the person their missing item (I've never ever heard of a hotel doing this for anyone). The engineer, Greg, helped me fix my car and I was on my way. I have never stayed at this hotel because I live nearby but based on this experience I would highly recommend it based on the courteousness of the staff. The lobby was also clean and bright and this hotel is right on the light rail line to BWI airport. I highly recommend Days Inn at Hopkins Place.

Reviews.Title: “Problem/Corrected”
Reviews.Author: J F
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel while in town for business events every year for the past 8 years. It has served our needs adequately. This time we were in a room that had an issue with the air conditioner. The room was stuffy and warm and so we turned on the AC and when we returned 5 hours later it was still stuffy & warm. Maintenance was called. There are only 2 elevators and a full house makes them run slow. When he eventually got there, he said that the BTU's were only 500 and that's all we could expect from the AC unit. After we told him we had stayed there every year for the past 8 years and NEVER had a problem cooling a room before, he said he'd change it out. Finally the room was comfortable enough to sleep in! He said the GM there will not tolerate a problem NOT being solved right away. Glad that was the case.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Personable Staff, Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: Days Inn Inner Harbor was very clean and the front desk guy "at check in" (Gerald) was very accomodating, there was never a problem with any of our requests.. He was more than willing to extend himself. The restaurant staffer (Charita) went above and beyond in assistanting us while dining. She always came back to our table to check on us - that's what you call "VERY good customer service" All in all, the weekend was a pleasant experience. Will DEFINITELY go back. We stayed on the 2nd floor, the rooms were modernized and up-to-date, good job on the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very reasonable pricing”
Reviews.Author: jayshaw83
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying here. We had a family of 4 and the room we had was a very nice size. The front desk clerks were amazing. The location was perfect, it was literally around the corner from the national aquarium. The parking was also affordable since they do not have a parking lot. It was $10 flat rate for up to 12 hrs. Room service was good. The staff is very friendly. Anything that we needed, they made sure they provided us with it.

Reviews.Title: “This Is a Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cptcwk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I often visit Baltimore and we have stayed at the Days Inn Inner Harbor on three or four occasions in the recent past. We have been consistently pleased with our experience. The facility is well designed and impeccably maintained. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished. The staff is uniformly pleasant and exceptionally helpful. All of this and the room rates are very reasonable! Although it is only a Days Inn, the hotel has an outdoor pool and a very pleasant restaurant. Parking is available in an adjacent, private garage, which makes it convenient for visitors who arrive by car. This hotel is conveniently located: the convention center is just down the street and the inner harbor and other downtown attractions are only a couple of blocks away. I give this hotel an "Excellent" rating because it achieves everything it that it sets out to do: it is a well run, well staffed, well maintained, reasonably priced, basic hotel conveniently located in the heart of a major city. I don't think that you can ask for much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable inner harbor value”
Reviews.Author: Dana_SF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and comfortable. The decor is nothing special, but the free internet, the excellent fitness room, and the low price make this a pretty compelling choice in the inner harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “I had to come to Baltimore for John Hopkins Wilmer Eye Inst.”
Reviews.Author: Carrie A
Reviews.Content: Everyone from the front desk to security,restraunt,Cafe were all wonderful they treated me and my friend awesome. My friend has breathing problems and we wanted to visit the inner harbor so they called around for a wheel chair so that i could push her around the inner harbor. They answered questions for us and went out of their way to help us with all our needs. I would definately recommend and come back here, hopefully it would be for pleasure next time but even if not i would come back. Thank you to all the staff at Days Inn Baltimore Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Will always stay here in the future”
Reviews.Author: momoTHEcat
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the Days Inn at Inner Habour in Baltimore. The staff was without exception helpful, kind and so professional. Prechious (sp?) at the front desk was fantastic as was Gerard. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay fabulous. Even the security guards were so, so nice. The housekeeping staff was fantastic. The restaurant had the best food we ate while on our 5 night stay in Baltimore at great prices. Can't think of even one complaint. Everything was fantastic. Great experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value and way better than what I was expecting.”
Reviews.Author: clh6262
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was impressed. I was not expecting this level of service from what I thought was a mid to low level chain hotel. Rooms: Small but comfortable. The rooms have a nice t.v., comfortable bed, bathroom amenities, hair dryer, mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. There was a small basket with bottled water, popcorn, and granola bar that was replenished each day. Nice touch. Everything appeared to be very clean. One odd thing is that the sink/ vanity area in our room was separate from the shower area. Not a problem - just something of note. Also - free, but slow, wifi is available throughout the hotel. I also noticed that there was a pool for the warmer months. Service: From check-in to check-out the staff was courteous and willing to help any way they could to make the stay better. Room service is available from their restaurant, and, while not fancy, does the trick. Location: Can't beat it. It was very convenient to park, enter, exit. That is really great for a downtown hotel. Parking is $23 dollars a day extra - but the garage is attached to the hotel, so it was well worth it. The convention center is just down the street - along with a couple of sports bars if you're there for a weekend and need to watch a game. The attached bar/ restaurant is a plus. If you are working and don't have time or energy to go out - it really does help to have a restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner right there off the lobby. I generally stay in Holiday Inn Express or higher end hotels - but this worked out really well for a gal traveling solo (on a budget) for business. One word of caution: If you are not used to city noise like me, it might be bothersome. But that will be true of any downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Mix Business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: hersheykissk
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. I needed a place to stay overnight and meet with 2 college advising clients in Baltimore. At my phone request, the front desk gladly permitted an early check-in. The room I chose was ideally suited for this work session. It was large and L-shaped with a desk, sitting area with a coffee table, and wi-fi at one end and the bed, etc. at the opposite end. The staff, starting with doorman was, very friendly and helpful. They are definitely customer-centered. There was a microwave and mini-fridge also in the room. A nice touch was the bag of microwave popcorn and granola bars. The only suggestions I'd have for improving the room are to add a second phone and clock on the desk since the only ones were next to bed at the other end of the L. After we finished our work, it was an easy several blocks walk to take the girls for dinner at Inner Harbor where we also did some window shopping. Booking on-line at the Day's Inn website made the price very reasonable, particularly considering the location. As I was leaving the next day, Ravens fans were on the streets everywhere walking to the stadium for a playoff game. The hotel is centered near much of the downtown action, including the Baltimore Convention Center....a very nice convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great value!”
Reviews.Author: chris o
Reviews.Content: All the good reviews are true. My aunt and I needed an overnight room in the downtown are and, after reading the positive reviews online about this hotel, we chose it for the value and location. The service was excellent -- in particular the night desk manager, Gerald, was amazingly helpful. He fully explained our parking options and helped us pick the best choice. (The parking lot was connected to the hotel, very safe and cheaper than parking charged by most of the area hotels.) In addition, he kindly offered a flexible checkout time. We were most impressed, however, by the immaculately clean room. For a value hotel option, the decor and comfort of our room rivaled any Marriott, albeit a bit smaller. The beds and pillows were wonderfully comfy; a new, large flat screen TV offered a wide range of cable and On Demand viewing; and, the (very clean) large fridge and coffee/tea maker and microwave offered lots of in-room snacking options. Don't hesitate to stay at this Days Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Overnight”
Reviews.Author: jaimmami
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick overnight on New Year's Eve. The price was right and we knew we wouldn't be spending much time there anyway. Overall, the Days Inn was fine, but I don't think I would stay there for more than a night. The service at the front desk was very good. The rooms were clean, but very small and modest. The beds were comfortable though. The elevators were EXTREMELY SLOW and luckily we had very few trips up and down.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: rival88
Reviews.Content: I booked the Days Inn Inner Harbor in Baltimore on New Year`s Eve because my family and I were booked for a cruise on January 1. I had absolutely no hesitations booking at this hotel because of all the EXCELLENT reviews I read about the hotel on this site. I wanted to compliment first off, Gerald of front desk because he really went above and beyond to accommodate my family. He also has a great sense of humor - he told me both men (and women) working at the hotel were allowed to grow goatees! :) He also mentioned on several occasions that the General Manager of the hotel (Dennis) was absolutely wonderful to work with and this gave him the ability to make exceptions for us and really treat us with fairness and respect. I think sometimes Baltimore can get a bad reputation from the media etc. and certainly among people we know, but I can tell you that our experience from the people we encountered in Baltimore (like Gerald) would make us return again and again. Shout out to everyone at Days Inn Inner Habor from Toronto, Canada. I just hope we can return the hospitality one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price Quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: ebartholomeus
Reviews.Content: Don't expect super luxury, but what is offered is excellent by people with a smile

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ampum
Reviews.Content: This hotel for a chain was excellent the rooms were large and clean and the bed was very comfortable. There was complimentary tea coffee popcorn and biscuit provided. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and when I wanted a stamp for a post card one member of staff took it to post for me without taking payment for the stamp. They were helpful in telling me how to get to places I wanted to visit and made sure to ask if I had managed to get to these places and if I had enjoyed it. It is close to the inner harbor and it is easy to walk there for restaurants and shopping and although it was November the weather was good and I was able to sit and enjoy the entertainment there.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Judy H
Reviews.Content: I spent 13 days in the Days Inn in Baltimore, MD while on jury duty. I was a small town girl in a big city all by myself. The staff in this hotel made me feel at home. They were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very nice. I enjoyed complimentary coffee, tea, popcorn, health bar and USA paper. I was given pamphlets and free transportation maps for sightseeing.I've traveled in the states and Europe but this hotel was the one that made me feel the most welcome. I staff was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Jets lose, but we 'won' by choosing this Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: kaw54realestate
Reviews.Content: Came in for two nights to see the city and root on my JETS (THAT didn't work out so good!) Was leery of Days Inn from my last stay at one of them over 20 years ago, but the General Manager, Dennis Dietz, personally took the time to address my concerns and he does a fantastic job! This was evident by the superior customer service and friendliness of all the staff, the cleanliness and quality of the entire hotel. Lobby, rest rooms and business center were all in tip top shape as was our room. Really comfortable and spacious too , with a good working desk, couch and we had a good night’s rest. The breakfast buffet , a little expensive ( not included, but we had a discount) was about what you'd expect in a hotel. Good, not great, but really convinient and again, good service there too. ( There are so many great restaurants for all budgets and tastes, nearby too.) This hotel is in a great location for sightseeing or taking in a baseball or football game. The Water Taxi is a great way to see the city; we were fortunate that the annual Fells Point Festival was going on that weekend. We WERENT so lucky to face the ferocious Ravens defense though. Wow! Those guys beat the snot out of Sanchez. Oh well, we had a great time, the crabs were fantastic- and we will return. AAA plus for value, service and comfort. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain & Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pinevalleyite
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate searching various sites - $89 before tax for a midweek room. Also came with a 25% coupon for use in their restaurant. The desk people couldn't have been more helpful. We wanted to go to Little Italy for dinner which is too far to walk & when we inquired about a good place, we were given a couple of options and one which they told us offered a free shuttle service to and from the restaurant. We chose that one, Germano's and were not disappointed. Anyway, we parked our car for just under 24 hours at the hotel & paid only $22 and were able to leave our bags with the desk when we checked out and went to the Aquarium for the day, picking them up when we went back for the car. Room was clean and spacious and overall a terrific stay if you don't need to be "right on the water."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin T
Reviews.Content: Clean & modern room with great service. We could walk a couple of blocks to the harbour & the place is just great with a mixture of good restaurants and shops. The attractions on the harbour would keep anyone well entertained for a holiday but if you just want to walk & enjoy the atmosphere & relax then it fits the bill even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Very centrally located. Clean, Friendly place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mccannclann
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip with friends to Baltimore. We made our reservations through Hotels.com and got a great rate. The hotel is a short walk from the MTA station which charges $1.60 to ride. Much cheaper than a taxi from the airport. There are many restaurants, pubs, shopping, night clubs within walking distance. Also, the aquarium. There is a very nice lobby, spacious rooms with very comfortable beds and big puffy pillows, and free wifi. The hotel has a nice restaurant (although we did not eat there) and a snack bar/coffee area. After an afternoon of walking and shopping, my friend and I were looking for an afternoon cup of coffee. The snack bar had closed and the restaurant did not open until 5:00. Gerald at the front desk is AWESOME! He offered to go to the kitchen and make us personal cups. It was so thoughtful and he really went out of his way to make us feel at home. He had a great restaurant recommendation as well and told us about the free shuttle van. If you stay here, make sure you visit a place called Howl at the Moon. It is a dueling piano bar. The players there need to know a minimum of 2,000 songs. The guests write down their suggestions on slips and put them up on the piano. They played everything from Frank Sinatra, to Billy Joel, to Snoop Dog and Beyonce! GREAT TIME!!! I would stay here again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great bargain priced hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: EBurden
Reviews.Content: I booked here based on the price and proximity to the convention center, It was about a half or a third of the convention recommended hotels. Because of that, I expected Spartan accommodations, but instead got a charming hotel, nice lobby, spacious rooms and free (albeit pokey) wifi. There is a restaurant in house and the staff at hotel and restaurant are ULTRA courteous. Right across the street from the convention center, a block from the light rail from the airport and a few blocks from the inner harbor restaurants and attractions. Wonderful. Gives me a whole new perspective on Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jasonleg
Reviews.Content: Booked for two nights as I was attending a conference at the Sheraton which is a block away. The rate at Days Inn was a third of the Sheraton. The check in process was quick and friendly and we were provided with information about the immediate area. The rooms are functional and may not be as nice as more expensive hotels but they are clean and spacious. There was a nice big HD television, a fridge and microwave but the best thing of all is that they have free wifi for guests. As this was a work related trip could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Ravens-Orioles-Inner Harbor Stay”
Reviews.Author: teechur
Reviews.Content: Came to a Baltimore Ravens game and chose Days Inn due to closeness and cost (compared to other downtown sites). This is in a great location for either a Ravens or Orioles game or to site-see downtown harbor--all of which are within easy walking distance (a few blocks to half-a-mile). There are also lots of great restaurants nearby. The room had a microwave & refrigerator. It also had free--one water bottle, one package of microwave popcorn, one granola bar. The bed was comfortable, room clean & bug-free, although some parts were old/worn. They do not offer a free breakfast, but do have a little restaurant where you can pay $13 (!) for a small buffet breakfast (which was almost the same as offered free at Choice Hotels). They do have a coffee pot in the room with 2 coffee packets--the lobby also has a 'java' niche where you can buy more coffee & sweet rolls, muffins, etc. All staff were VERY friendly and willing to answer questions. They have adjourning parking garage privileges for $22 per 24 hours. Take the ticket and have it scanned by the hotel front desk...that way you can go in and out of the lot (using the ticket) without paying over and over. The $22 is put on your hotel account. If you have a vehicle, I recommend visiting McHenry Fort (3-5 miles away) where Francis Scott Key wrote the National Anthem (nearby) while the Fort was being bombed. There is also a bar that had very good sandwiches (Hull Street Blues)...I loved my chicken Rueben!...with friendly local characters who added to our visit enjoyment! The only negative is one that many large city downtowns have---a few blocks in several directions and you are in a run-down section of town with all that implies. However, the Inner Harbor area/convention center/stadium areas felt very safe and comfortable to me. I would not hesitate to stay here again. (Even though the "Occupy Baltimore" group was just one block away and played bongo drums several hours EVERY night...which was heard in our room)

Reviews.Title: “Conveient location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TzoNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Inn Inner Harbor over a long weekend for relaxation. The location, just a few blocks from the Inner Harbor, was very convenient. Staff was friendly,helpful and didn't bat an eye when I asked for someone to open the door to my room when I couldn't. Despite warnings everywhere about the hazards of in-room safes, I had no problem using mine. would stay there again unless I wanted to impress someone with glamour, which this inexpensive little hotel foes not have. Entirely y cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “A great value in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: MarkSV
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore for a conference that was being held in the nearby Sheraton, but it was booked, so I ended up at the Days Inn Inner Harbor. What luck! All week fellow participants where complaining about the Sheraton, and I got to rave about the good deal I had gotten at the Days Inn. A far superior stay at half the cost. Service at the front desk was friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and well maintained, with comfortable beds and in room amenities such as microwave and refrigerator. The bathrooms are small and the vanity spartan, but the desk space and lamps were set up well for work in the room. Definitely one of the nicer Days Inns I have visited. And the location is convenient to everything downtown and at the harborfront. I would highly recommend for the cost conscious business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Baseball Game with My Son”
Reviews.Author: RSL201
Reviews.Content: My son and I went to the last series of the year vs. the Red Sox. We wanted to stay close to Camden Yards and chose Days Inn with great results. The room was quiet, clean but a bit small. It was fine since we weren't there much. It's perfectly located close to Camden, Inner Harbor, the Aquarium and yes - Starbucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LeslieGray
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were so friendly & helpful. No wonder they call Baltimore Charm City! The location is a reasonable walk to the Inner Harbor and practically across the street from the Convention Center. The lodging is nice and comfortable, not luxurious. The restaurant & bar were nice but nothing special. It's handy to have there if you don't feel like going out. We had a very reasonable rate. It was a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn equals A-Plus”
Reviews.Author: alohadj6
Reviews.Content: The check in was fast and easy. Every staff member I encountered was extremely friendly and polite; from the front desk, the housekeeping the security and the maintenance. The entire hotel was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable decent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ral338
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget hotel, very well located near the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. It's a block from the light rail - I arrived via Amtrak and the LRT is at the train station. The room was large, although the bed was soft for my taste. The room was quiet. A good size bathroom, the shower had good pressure and hot water. Plenty of towels of decent quality - some hotels really skimp in that area. The room includes a fridge that is usable, not filled with expensive minibar items - there's a little store in the lobby for that. There is also a microwave and coffee maker in the room. It also has free wifi and I found that to work well. The negatives were pretty minor: when I ran the climate control (AC) it was pretty loud, but I didn't need it much. And the alarm clock was pretty hard to figure out. I've stayed here in the past with similar findings. I expect to stay here again on trips to Baltimore, the other hotels in the area are much more expensive and I don't need anything fancy. My friend and I did have breakfast in the hotel restaurant for convenience. It was OK, but nothing special, particularly considering the cost. One other hint: Check the various travel services for pricing. I got a deal on one of the websites that was about half what the Days Inn website was quoting, with 24 hour cancellation privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: Bill A
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is close to many attractions. The staff @ this hotel was absolutely a pleasure, some of the nicest, courteous people we have met and we have stayed in hotels across the country. Front Desk, concierge, wait staff in the hotel restaurant, all were ready to serve, and/or answer questions. Down side-parking!! didnt realize hotel didnt have own parking lot, so extra charge was a surprise. Rooms clean and neat, just not fan of rain shower head. Recommend satying here and would stay there again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Our first visit and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: kaw54
Reviews.Content: Arrived Sat, 1 Oct around noon after a long trip. Pat, at reception ,was so very helpful, friendly and accomadating. Even though it was early, I'd called ahead that morning and sure enough, we were able to check in right away, even though the hotel was packed full. The rooom exceeded our expectations. Spacious, very clean and well laid out, comfy king size bed and linens and a nice sofa as well. Large flat screen TV, free ( but a bit slow) internet, amply sized work desk as well as fridge and micro. Nice touch of having a bottle of water, snack and bag of popcorn too! After we returned from touring Ft. McHenry ( which was great0 and a sumptious dinner ( LP STEAMERS!), we returned to have our parking card stamped and Geraldo, at the front desk was ALSO very friendly, informative and pleasant. In fact, ALL the staff we encountered throughout our stay seemed so. For convenience, on Sunday morn we had a filling enjoyable breakfast buffet and our waiter Valentino kept the hot coffee coming ! Although it was a bit chilly, the water taxi was on our list of things to do and we 'lucked' out, as it was the annual Fells Point Festival which offered a vast array of arts and crafts, music and food and just plain fun! George Gilbert, the comic magician was amazing!. Then it was off to the JETS game and THAT was a pitiful display by my Gang Green. The Ravens sure dominated, but it is a real nice stadium and an enjoyable time, in spite of the loss. No problem going to -our leaving the game; we even 'walked around ' a little on the way home - and this was midnight! We had a fantastic time in Baltimore, and the ammenities , decor and service of the Days Inn here were all of top notch. As for the complaints about the elevators? The place was packed full and other than two relatively short waits, we had speedy service every time ( 8th floor). Finally, upon checkout Monday, Deborah, with a smile, made sure our account was properly settled and we reluctantly loaded up the car and headed out. There are many places to see, a wide variety of attractions and the Days Inn is centrally located and a good value too. I'd had some misgivings about staying here, but all for naught. Dennis Dietz, the manager has done a SUPER job in the operation of this hotel. Customer satisfaction really seems to be a priority with him and it flows all the way down to every employee. Kudos ! For sure, we would plan to stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: J F
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here each year for the past 5 years and it is a consistently good stay. The hotel is not new by any means and is dated in its decor, but the convenience is what makes it an excellent stay for us when doing business at the convention center. The restaurant is good and saves us walking around on nights when we're too tired to hoof it to one of the many excellent restaurants in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place-don't forget anything when you leave”
Reviews.Author: wendee817
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend of baseball and fun. Overall the hotel was clean and nice. Location was very convienient to Oriole Park and Inner Harbor. My complaint is that I left my prescription glasses in their case on the nightstand and I forgot to pack them. When we got home several hours later, I noticed my mistake. We called the hotel immediately and spoke to a woman named Kim. She said she would check with housekeeping and call us back. She did just 15 minutes later. She told us that C.J. would call us the next day. They didn't, so my husband called C.J. He was told security closet was locked but they would get back to us. We called a few more times and long story short, still no answer! I would have paid shipping cost to get my glasse back, But still have no answer as to where they went.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Professional Staff – Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MKBelanger
Reviews.Content: This Hotel should be rated # 1, Close to the Convention Center and three blocks from Inner Harbor. The staff and accommodations were excellent, recently renovated and it shows very well, I traveled to Baltimore on Business and during my stay everyone was extremely helpful from Mike at the front door to Justin at the Desk. My luggage was damaged and basically destroyed during my travel in and even though stressful the GM and Sales Director stepped in to make sure my stay was not only memorable but unforgettable as all my worries were wiped out when they immediately offered solutions. Thank you for all your help, I am the poster child for Days Inn Inner Harbor Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Marcia1979
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting at the Days Inn Baltimore Inner Harbor...what a wonderful, fantastic experience! Newly renovated guest rooms and terrific meeting space. Alison, the Director of Sales...goes above and beyond to make your meeting and banquet events an exceptional experiece. Dennis, the General Manager, treats each and every guest like they're family and he has instilled this in his wonderful, friendly staff! This hotel has the perfect location and everything is within walking distance. This full service hotel has a great restaurant, bar & cafe. I would highly recommend this hotel to any type of traveler...whether coming for business or pleasure...this hotel is an excellent choice for both! Thank you to the amazing staff for making our stay exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: joe48
Reviews.Content: great hotel !! close to ball park, and harbor. great little bar, with great asian wings. probably 5th time here, so much cleaner and newer than radisson. also, had a $25% OFF WHEN I BOOKED FOR FOOD AND BEVERAGE !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, great room rates”
Reviews.Author: Wolffian
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the reviews expressing a terrific location for the Inner harbor and the very helpful staff. The room rates were far lower compared to nearby hotels and the parking, which is located in a deck adjacent to the hotel was $22.00 per night; again, lower compared to nearby hotels. The hotel has been renovated so all the rooms have new carpet, furniture and the bed was pretty comfortable. I had a room on the top floor (9th) but was a bit damp/musty smelling, the air conditioning is not central air but one of those standard floor units under the window. I do not mind these because it provides some background noise while sleeping. The hotel is in the city so you will hear emergency vehicles but I did not hear any major traffic noise, occasional noise in the corridor. Free wifi was great. I tried the restaurant downstairs and it was fine for basic bar food. The little coffee shop near the front desk served usual muffins and coffees. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Before booking....”
Reviews.Author: kenko
Reviews.Content: ... at another hotel, definitely check out the Days Inn Inner Harbor. The location was great. within walking distance of the Inner Harbor, Camden Yards and the Power Plant area. I felt the area to be safe. The staff was great...friendly, informative and helpful. Thank you for the ease of check-in! The pool area was small but had room for lounge chairs. It was located outside between the parking area and hotel. Unfortunatley, it was raining and we weren't able to use it. Our room was very clean as was the bathroom (with plenty of towels) - thank you housekeeping. We had a coffee maker, frig, and micro. The beds were very comfortable. The hotel itself had a small lounge (with cold beer) and a restaurant. Parking was additional (minimal charge, especially for the cost of the room) with in and out privileges. Since it rained, we used our car to drive to Fells Point - what a great area!! Went to the Fieldhouse (which advertised as a Penn State/ Steelers Bar but saw no signs of either) . Enjoyed our time at Ale Marys and also Kislings, which had an awesome crab cake special and beer prices for happy hour. Also ate at Miss Shirleys. (I highly recommend both places). We plan on coming to Baltimore again and will definely stay at the Days Inn Inner Harbor! Thanks for making our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JMCLSCMAC
Reviews.Content: My family was at the Inaugural Grand Prix race in Baltimore and stayed at the Days Inn. It was the perfect location and the staff was wonderful. They offered help and assistance with directions and ideas. Someone even thought to provide a basket of ear plugs for the guests. I was really impressed with the employees genuine pleasant personalities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience during Frightening Time”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth D
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to describe how wonderful the staff of the Days Inn Inner Harbor was to me and my family. We were vacationing in Ocean City, MD, when our father was seriously injured in a beach accident. He was life-flighted to the University of Maryland Medical Center, and spent 5 days in the shock trauma ICU. Looking for a place to stay in Baltimore, I contacted this Days Inn. The staff was very understanding of our situation, and quickly offered us a room for the University of Maryland discounted rate. Looking back on our 5 day stay at the Days Inn Inner Harbor, we could not think of one thing to complain about. The hotel, itself, was very clean and neat, and the staff was extraordinary. From the workers at the front desk, to the security team, to the custodians, we never experienced any negativity in the attitudes of the staff. Each smiled, asked us if we were enjoying our stay, and ended the conversation by telling us to “have a wonderful day.” They also had a genuine concern for the health of our father. When visiting Baltimore in the future, there is no doubt as to where I will stay. The Days Inn Inner Harbor was a wonderful experience during a frightening time. My family is truly appreciative of all that this wonderful staff did for us. Tank you, one million times over!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wedding accommodations”
Reviews.Author: purplepurchaser
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Katherine Bent and crew, our family and friends had a great stay at the days Inn for my daughter's wedding. Not only did they accommodate us with early check ins, but arrangements were made for the bar to stay open, with drink specialist, after our return from the reception at midnight. Rooms were clean, and were in close proximity to one another making it even more fun!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: bryangbrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Days Inn this past weekend and the rooms were very affordable and the customer service was very impressive. I dealt with Gerald at the front desk when checking in and found him to be extremely helpful, professional, and took pride in his work. Everything went well and all of his suggestions in regards to parking were perfect. I checked out the next day and Tavon was very courteous as well and was also very helpful. I wasn't looking for an extravagant place to stay at since I would only be in the room a couple hours but this was the perfect place to go to for what I was looking for. I will say the High Speed Internet was not very High Speed, however I will most definitely come back and stay there the next time I am in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: kamswim85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was probably one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. My family booked the hotel for us because it was a good price. But the price was simply not worth it. First getting into the hotel was a nightmare! We drove around in loops for about 25 minutes trying to get into the place. The signs that said "entrance here" with an arrow were after the actual entrance getting us disoriented only to have to loop around again. Once we got in we only learned that we had to go back out to the street to access the parking garage - which was $22 per night! And that was where the next problem set in. They told us it was good for 24 hours - don't believe them. It was only good until 12pm noon - because if you wanted to walk around after checking out like what we did - we got charged another day which was a complete rip off. There were four of us down to check in and we all got the same story - 24 hour parking fee - which is supposed to be a great deal and perk for staying at the hotel, according to them. So for my dad who was there for less than 24 hours he had to pay $44 to park. The location was okay. They say inner harbor but it is about a 7-8 block to the actual inner harbor. And it wasn't the safest location. As a female I refused to go anywhere without someone else in my party with me. And that was even if we were walking down to the corner bar a block away. The cleanliness was definitely subpar. The room size was decent. The tub was not draining properly and with four of us in a room we had to wait a half hour in between showers just to allow the tub to drain. A big inconvenience. The windows were definitely not sound proof. The first night I was kept up listening to sirens for about 2-3 hours and then the second night my brother-in-law was up half the night listening to the rain (that's bad when you can hear the rain and your up on the 6th floor) The elevators were a disaster! We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights for a total of 36 hours and one of the two elevators was broken for at least 15 hours. The morning we were checking out there was a line for the elevator to go down of about 15 people on our floor alone! (the elevators were small and could only fit maybe 8-10 people and that was if they were sandwiched in which no one really wants. Plus there were 8-9 floors - so what if there were that many waiting on each floor?!?!) We decided not to wait because it took an average of 5-10 minutes to wait for the elevator normally when both were working and we didn't have a half hour to stand around and waste. So we had to take the stairs six flights down with our luggage. That was a joy... All in all I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The money it looks like you are saving you are not with the added taxes and then the expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff, Great Location in Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: OhioOriolesFan
Reviews.Content: Our family, two adults, two children, travelled from Ohio to the hotel. From checkin to checkout the hotel staff was most accomodating and efficient. Property appears to be somewhat older, but we found the guest rooms, public areas, restaurant, and swimming pool to be clean and nicely decorated. The location is right next to the convention center, just a few minutes walk from Oriole Park at Camden Yards, the Inner Harbor, and the Inner Harbor shopping mall. Restaurant has a Sunday buffet that offers a very attractive price for children, making it very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Zilla99
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night, but was pleasantly surprised. Hotel is in an excellent location, only a short walk to the Orioles and the Inner Harbour. Restaurant had exceptional waiter and the food was plentiful and good. Only drawback was the ancient elevators that you constantly have to wait for. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: charlie p
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came from Caesars Palace in Atlantic City from the night before. They had a deluxe room for us. We paid more ($20 per night ) at Caesars and got less. Days Inn at Inner Harbor was clean and conveniently located in the city. Well worth it. We will come again.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T LET THE NAME FOOL YOU-----THIS PLACE IS VERY NICE! Baltimore's best kept secret.”
Reviews.Author: merimedicn
Reviews.Content: I came to Baltimore for a medical convention. At first I was booked at the Sheritan then changed to Days Inn since I was only staying one night and it was much cheaper ($89 vs $169). I was a little hesitant as let's face it most Days Inns are foreign owned and operated and well associated with the words low class, dirty and bug infested. I was so pleasantly suprised and thrilled at how wonderful this place was. The staff are very helpful and work hard to ensure you have a pleasant stay. The room was very nice and clean, there is a separate sitting area with a couch, beds are comfy and there is a microwave and fridge in the rooms. Free WiFi is also included in your price. I would compare this hotel to a Hampton Inn with free internet. The resturant in the hotel is not bad. Very resonably price and decent. I give the resturant 3 stars and the bartender with his wonderful cocktails a 4.5 (he makes a very yummy Amareto Sour). If you want a nice place to stay while staying within a budget, STAY HERE you won't be disappointed. However, if you have money to burn and want to spend over twice as much for a room in a little newer hotel, the Sheritan and Marriot are about 2 blocks away. Keep in mind on top of the pricey room you will also spend an extra $12/day for internet and most rooms do not have microwaves and refridgerators in them. However, I say, stay here and take the extra money you would have spent for a room at the Marriot and have a lovely dinner at one of Baltimore's fine resturants. I recommend Prime Steak House about a mile from the hotel. It is owned and operated by Executive Chef Tim Dean (seen on season 7 of Top Chef). Lovely food and won't kill your pocket book. OR you can take a $20 cab ride to Toby's Dinner theater located in the Best Western and see some real Broadway talent on stage. The food is "OK" and dinner and the show is about $54 but well worth every dime. Their singers, dancers and actors are absolutely wonderful! I can't encourage you enough to give this hotel a try. At our medical conference next year there will not be any doubt where I will stay. : )

Reviews.Title: “Clean well-situated hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: VBCinNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and the staff was great. The (pay) parking garage is connected to the hotel by a walkway. The rooms are a little small but nice. They have a restaurant and outdoor pool. The hotel is close to the Convention center and the city-run FREE tourist shuttle bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable clean place to stay close to the Inner Harbour”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtr4veler
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by how friendly & helpful the staff were. The room was clean with a little fridge and microwave (which didn't work in our room but it wasnt a problem since we only stay for 1 nights) I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Price, and Service--great value”
Reviews.Author: fr0mVA
Reviews.Content: We arrived early, but rooms were available, so they cheerfully checked us in. The first room we entered had a funky smell, though, so they switched us immediately to another room. Very helpful and friendly staff. The room was fine--comfy bed and linens. The hotel is in a lovely old brick building. The lobby has cushy leather sofas and upholstered chairs, some in a more private hallway between the desk and the restaurant and the others in the main area with a big screen TV. The pool was popular, but I didn't go in. I prefer a pool/hot tub to myself. 24-hour fitness room and also a business center with 3 computers for guests' use. One awkward thing I would recommend to the staff to change: Put up a sign to limit computer use when people are waiting. A woman came in to use the computer and had to sit on the floor and wait for one. I was the last one on, but I got off quick. I just wanted to order my aquarium tickets, anyway. Parking is $22 and ends at noon on checkout day. Then the rate is $22 after 2 hours, so if you plan to stay longer than noon, you should move your car across the street to the Arena parking, which is $10 flat fee all day. Great location, across from the convention center, about .5 mile from the Inner Harbor. There's a free bus that comes every 15 minutes if you don't want to walk. I would definitely stay again. At $104 a night, I saved money, even after paying for breakfast and parking. And the staff really made you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: rodn27
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff all around. Rooms were clean and although a bit spartan was a great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Two Employees (Ms. Preshess Bynum and Richard Tnors-Balman)”
Reviews.Author: Valtastic
Reviews.Content: I am not sure of the correct spelling of these employees names, so I start with offering my apology if the spelling is incorrect. However, I want to compliment both of these people on their exemplary service respectively as well as their professionalism. Many times people will take the time report all of the bad things that take place around us, but today I am happy to report on a wonderful experience. I hope that Preshess and Richard will keep up the great work and that it did not go unnoticed because sometimes working with the public can be a monster!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with our room”
Reviews.Author: tcw14
Reviews.Content: Traveled to an O's game and stayed at the hotel for 1 night. We had a room with a queen bed and found the room to be very spacious. It appeared to show its age a bit but nothing that I would get excited over. The only negative that I would state is that the hallways and elevators were hot due to no AC but our room was just fine. When I visit the Inner Harbor area again I will definately be staying at the Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: poppa13
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, i thought because of the chain name it would not be that good for the price but i was wrong. great hotel great service my rom was spotless and very comfortable great hotel would deffinitely stay again . have to pay to park but every hotel in area is the same.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cubnurse
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We came to Baltimore for an Orioles game and wanted the convenience of staying near Camden Yards. Most of the upscale hotels in this area ran $200-$300 per night, which we could not afford. We did some internet research and found that the Days Inn Inner Harbor had excellent reviews. We were a little skeptical at first because of a couple of bad hotel experiences recently. We thought that $99 per night was too good to be true for this area. We were wrong! The lobby was very nice, the rooms were clean, and the staff were courteous. The room decor was modern and the beds were comfy! The check-in and check-out process went smoothly, and the staff even allowed us to store our luggage after check-out, so that we could explore the city before heading home! Some other reviews spoke of expensive parking, but really, it was comparable to any other inner harbor/downtown hotel parking! The parking garage was attached and very convenient. Well worth the $22! We have stayed in hotels up and down the east coast, in Baltimore, NYC, DC, and this was by far one of the best experiences we have had, EVER. It was the best value, service, and clean, not to mention conveniently located a few short blocks from the stadium and the inner harbor! We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonably priced, and VERY convenient!”
Reviews.Author: uscmike1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week for business. The staff was competent, the hotel was clean, and the location was wonderful. I didn't even have to rent a car! I took the light rail from the airport to the stop right next to the hotel/Camden Yard for a couple dollars (pocket change)- I was within walking distance to Camden Yard, the Inner Harbor area with all the restaurants and nightlife anyone could ask for, and I worked at the office 1 block away- All for an affordable price. There are hotels that may be a little more upscale or have more expensive amenities nearby, but the location of this hotel is perfect for someone who doesn't want to pay for the additional fluffy items that they don't need or plan to use. On top of that- it has alot of amenities too. For less! I was very pleased with my room, my stay, and this hotel in general. The one thing that I will say is not to put down the city or especially not this wonderful hotel- but for those of you from smaller cities and safe places- be warned that you need to know where you're going in Baltimore and not wander down the wrong blocks/alleys alone at night- in fact, walking around alone at night in general is just a bad idea. Aside from the enormous, and at times aggressive homeless population of beggars and bums in the city, there are also some very poorly lit alleys with sketchy people literally only a couple hundred yards from nice blocks of fine restaurants and entertainment. That is not meant to scare anyone off, as I am VERY pleased with my experiences in Baltimore and it is beautiful and full of great entertainment and food... Just a reminder to be aware of your surroundings and take the proper safety precautions necessary in ANY major urban area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with High Value”
Reviews.Author: ajhorv
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Days Inn Inner Harbor for 5 days and it was the perfect location...Walk to Inner Harbor, Camden Yards. Aquarium, Science Museum, restaurants, etc, etc. We had the kids up with us including new baby and 3.5 year old. For a very reasonable price, it was the best value in the city and we slept like logs after long days exploring what the city had to offer. Staff was always very helpful and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. We will stay here again...and again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel with very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: wfoust
Reviews.Content: Family of seven stayed two nights here. The rooms were very clean, attractive with updated furnishings & comfy beds. Micro & fridge in rooms. Pool & courtyard very nice. I'll give the staff an A+++++. (no free continental breakfast at this location, but restaurant on site). Parking $22/day. Great location to the Inner Harbor. Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional three-star hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: RuNanS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding and highly recommended for tourists and business visitors to Baltimore. I was a medical patient at nearby Johns Hopkins Hospital; for me the hotel was an especially good value. It offered a special rate of $99/night, plus free taxi vouchers to and from the hospital. Other welcome features included free email access in the hotel's 24-hour Business Center and an inexpensive washer and dryer for cleaning one's own clothes. The location was perfect, a 5-minute walk to the Inner Harbor tourism center, as well as major bus lines. Hotel staff were consistently friendly and efficient, especially Pat on the front desk and Elizabeth in the dining room. I will definitely stay here again whenever business or pleasure bring me back to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed in ever.”
Reviews.Author: vhk1
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore last week for part business part pleasure. I was so impressed with the location, the staff, and the amenities. I used the restaurant, bar, pool, fitness center and business center and all were first class. I felt very safe in the area and it could not be beat for convenience. We were two women traveling alone and we never felt unsafe at any time. The staff was just more than accomadating. They were fabulous. Anne in the restaurant especially made me feel at home. We were within a few blocks of Inner Harbor area, basillica (which is well worth the time to see) Camden Yards (across the street literally)--just a great stay thanks so much

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: bearpawqs
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference and was very pleased that this hotel was across the street from the convention center. I ended up here because I registered for the conference late and this was the only place left. It was also the most reasonable price wise. The front desk staff were excellent, very friendly, cheerful, and accommodating. On check in I asked about check out times and if I could keep my luggage until I left for the airport. The front desk staff changed my check out time at no charge in order to accommodate my schedule. The room came with a small fridge and microwave, fabulous! Given the heat and humidity this was a welcome amenity! There was plenty of space in the room, tons of pillows, and the beds were comfortable. I would have no problem staying here again. So what are those areas needing upgrades? As with most older hotels the elevators can be slow and crowded when the place is full. The elevator lobbies on each floor is very narrow. There really is no room to accommodate people with luggage waiting to get on and people coming off the elevator with luggage. I was on the fifth floor so I always took the stairs to go down and only used the elevator to go up. The stairs are definitely not pretty!!!! There was free wireless internet but the service was really slow. I made do and I find this to be fairly common when on the road. At least I didn't have to pay for the slow internet! I ate breakfast there my first morning. Understand I was there for an Infection Control conference when I say what I am about to say! I was seated at a table for four. The half of the table I was seated at was visibly wet, very wet. They must still be using a rag and bucket of solution to clean tables. Whoever wiped half the table did not wring out the rag very well. Not to mention they should not be doing this in the first place. Then the coffee mugs were set on the table upside down so the lip you drink from is sitting in the wet dirty solution. Needless to say I moved to the dry side of the table. Wait, what? Half the table was wet and half dry? I can only guess that only the side someone else sat was cleaned. I asked for just two eggs, once over, and toast. Well I got that plus fried potatoes, which I didn't want, nor did I eat. And I was of course charged an arm and a leg for it! She did not hear me, maybe it was my Midwestern accent! lol. Listen up restaurants, please don't put mugs upside down on a table and then expect me to drink out of it! That's what saucers or paper coasters are for! I did not eat there again. Again, I would stay there again just not eat there unless they change how they clean the table and then I would be more specific with the waitress about what I want and what I don't want. Stay on the upper floors. Primarily because of the elevator situation. If you are on the lower floors and are unable to use the stairs, the elevators are typically packed and you can't get on!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sc0nner
Reviews.Content: Went to the 1st Mariner Arena for a concert and chose to stay at the Days Inn Inner Harbor based on other Trip Advisor reviews and location. We were not disappointed! The Arena was even closer than I expected, just across the street. And only a brief 3 - 4 block walk was Inner Harbor. The room was very nice - a bit on the small side. I am assuming it was one of the older rooms since I chose not to select a renovated room (at an additional cost) upon making my reservation. All in all, perfect for a one night stay. Staff was very nice and efficient. Convenient parking.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sparklecitygirl01
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 2 nights while she had medical appointments at Johns Hopkins. The staff was friendly and so thoughtful! My mother uses a walker, and they were extremely helpful with getting her into and out of the hotel. The bellhops were terrific, and the front desk staff was incredible. I was very stressed when I arrived after traveling for over 7 hours with my Mom, and they went out of their way to accomodate our needs. Even the hostesses and wait staff in their restaurant were very friendly and helpful. A fantastic place to stay, especially if you have medical appointments at Johns Hopkins. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Good location, Good Find - would stay again (just in a different room)”
Reviews.Author: Coco1231
Reviews.Content: Decided to add a few extra days to our trip and visit Baltimore while attending a local family event close by. Wanted to stay in the Inner Harbor area at a decent hotel for a reasonable price - the Days Inn seemed like a good choice. Glad we did – the location was great. Easy walk to Inner Harbor, Basilica, Camden yards, Museums and more. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Parking convenient. Restaurant had good service and food (only tried Breakfast). Outside pool was quite refreshing. Only negative was the room layout was very odd – they had pushed the queen bed against the wall to the bathroom which made it difficult to get out bed if you were on the inside, leaving the rest of the room wide open. The foot of the bed was where the sink outside of the bathroom was, leaving very little space to maneuver. To watch TV in bed was awkward since it had to be turned so much. The microwave, refridge, coffee maker & free WI-FI all made up for the inconvenience and it was only for two nights. Would recommend to budget conscious travelers’ looking for a good central base close to the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations, Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: Elman1952
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here for the night while visiting the Inner Harbor. I picked it solely due the lower rate than other hotels in the area. I was very pleasantly surprised! The staff was very polite and attentive. The parking was easy and convenient. The room was excellent, including good air conditioning, clean comfortable bed, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, safe, hair dryer...the works! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Even for a Pittsburgh Steeler Fan, I was treated to FIVE STAR SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Bnews08
Reviews.Content: From the first moment the sliding doors opened as it walked into the well appointed lobby and friendly attentive staff as I was wearing my Steelers jersey, my experience was EPIC! Very good and speedy check in process, and the elevator ride was memorable as if was full of Ravens and Steelers fans. My room felt like a brand new car (smell and all). It seemed newly renovated and very modern. I enjoyed breakfast in the morning prior to the big game (which the Steelers on in the last two minutes of the game......PRICELESS)! I'll would reccomend anyone traveling to Baltimore for pleasure or business to choose the Days Inn Inner Harbor. Great value, good location and a well run operations. Kudos to the General Manager, Operations & Sales Team! I plan to return in Sept.11 and cannot wait! BNews08

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Vacay52
Reviews.Content: I called to make a reservation for myself and 3 friends to stay. The reservations representative introduced herself as India and informed me that, although they didn't have any rooms available, she would take my name and number and call me if there were any cancellations. Who does that? I have called just about every other hotel in the Inner Harbor (must be something big going on at the convention center) and no one else has offered to follow up. I should also mention that I called on Memorial Day, a day when I'm sure India would've rather not been working. She was so pleasant and helpful that I will call the Days Inn first next time I'm looking to stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: julesism
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn Inner Harbor was a decent little hotel, in a good location. The rooms were on the small side, but just right for a short two night stay. The room, linens, and bathroom were clean and in good shape. The front desk folks were polite and helpful. It also had a great little outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed. Good location. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: bassetdog
Reviews.Content: On a road trip of baseball grounds this was the first stop and we spent 2 nights here. Hotel has a great location for the ballpark. The rooms were a nice size. Facilities such as fridge and coffee filter were welcome. Everything was really good. No issues. No problems getting a baby crib delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, noisy, noisy”
Reviews.Author: DSXM
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel since my spouse had a business obligation in Baltimore and we were also on our way back from a long weekend in Washington, DC. I liked the location near Camden Yards since the Orioles would be home during our stay, and it was a short walk to the Inner Harbor as well. Expedia had good rates for this hotel compared with its neighbors. We arrived late in the evening, as we were visiting with family outside of DC. The security guard was very nice and assisted us with our luggage and check-in. The clerk at the desk was also friendly, however gave me unclear directions as to how to get on the parking garage at that time of night, which was very stressful for me since I had enough trouble finding the entrance to the hotel in the first place. I was pleased to see my bags and my souse in our room upon my return. I did not sleep very well the first night as the wall-unit air conditioner was very loud (even though there was a "sleep" mode) and the room would get too hot if it was not on. Being given a first floor room in a city, we did not get the chance to sleep late with trucks and morning traffic whizzing by. There was a cafe and a full service restaurant in the hotel, but I went to the nearby Starbucks for coffee and we used the in room fridge and microwave to heat up breakfast we bought in DC. The restaurant was kind enough to provide us with plates and utensils both mronings since there were none in the room. There was also a lack of information regarding the hotel and its policies in the room, which I found quite odd. The second night we slept a little better, but overall we did not have a relaxing stay. Although the room was nicely furnished and clean, it was very stuffy and the shower provided poor water pressure. Another annoying thing was that although we paid for 48 hours of parking, we really only got 36 hours as we arrived late in the evening and had to leave the garage by noon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: John4life
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff is phenomenal, and very courteous. I had a restful nights sleep, which I do not typically have when I am not in my own bed. Great bedding, the pillows were awesome, and the blankets were warm and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, service, value”
Reviews.Author: coach088
Reviews.Content: My collegues and I stayed there for a Soccer convention in January. The staff was wonderful and the location for the Convention Center can't be beat. I will bring my family back to Days Inn for a vacation stay--the location also works for sightseeing and family activities. Friendly manager, good food and lively bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Hestika
Reviews.Content: You can beat the price at daysinn. The rooms and service are great, close to the inner harbor and convention center. Hopkins bar and grill has good food and a great price.Highly recommened toall travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: 09Raleigh
Reviews.Content: One block from Convention Center can't be beat. Easy access to public parking garage. Hotel front desk validates for in/out and adds $20/day to bill. Validation very often fails and you will need to back out of the exit ramp and walk back to the hotel desk. They will be confused and slow to help. Breakfast at hotel is fairly priced but basic. Skip the limited buffet. Had reserved room with King bed for extra $20/night. Arrived at 4:30pm and King bed not available. Note that "bathroom" sink is in area with bed. Don't stay here if you want to sleep while your partner does morning routine of you would rather not watch your partner do his/her morning routine. Hotel subscribes to nickle/dime policy and will charge $1/day for the existence of a safe in the room. Next trip to Baltimore I will try another hotel near the Convention Center and look for a hotel offering a real/full bathroom, King bed as promised, hassle-free parking and no mandatory nickel/dime charges beyond the room rate quoted.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Personified!”
Reviews.Author: ametzger
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Days Inn - Inner Harbor in Baltimore for a convention and was blown away. I do quite a bit of travelling and I am not one to take the time to write a review ( good or bad ), however, I was so impressed with the staff at this hotel I felt compelled to let others know. They are experts at the seeming "lost art" of customer service, every staff member I encountered from the front desk and restaurant staff to the housekeepers and bar staff were friendly knowledgable and expedient. I might add that their superior service was executed despite the fact that the hotel was at full capacity due to the convention at the Baltimore Convention Center which is conveniently located right across the street. The rooms were great, (not a typical Days Inn) the food was great the staff was unbelievable and I guarantee when I am back in Baltimore I will chose the Days Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised - great value”
Reviews.Author: HER1
Reviews.Content: stayed overnight going from virginia beach to pa. Easy to find, easy to park, no complaints with room, great showerhead and water pressure, good food service. All around great value and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Never again will we stay at a Days Inn.”
Reviews.Author: vangelli9
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in Nov 2010 after noticing how convenient it was walking distance to the convention center (she had a teacher conference to go to) and after reading such nice reviews from other people; big mistake. The room was a decent size but that didn't make up for the cleanliness and overwhelming "hospital smell" that permeated the stale air. There were multiple pieces of food (appeared to be melted cheese) all along the walls and under the desk and the dust was beyond belief by the TV (still have pictures to prove it); so disgusting. After I had stated this to the front desk (and after being greeted with a very unfriendly attitude), she told me to wait and “be patient as the cleaning staff is getting to that floor.” It took over 6 hours for someone to go to the room and clean up (I had requested the clean at 10 am). One thing is certain, we will never stay at another days inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed overnight after a football game”
Reviews.Author: GeoGiantPa
Reviews.Content: I went to Baltimore with a buddy to see a Raven game. I picked this hotel because it was close to the stadium, the harbor and around the corner from a pub. I always try to give the good and the bad. The good - great location to walk to area attractions. Plenty of bars and pubs around the hotel. There was always a taxi at the front door if you want travel by car. You have to walk by the front desk and a door man to enter the hotel. The bad (well not really bad) - the hotel bar is small. Good for a nightcap but you will not want to hang out there. The rooms are not new or very big... but the room was very clean so it was easy to overlook this. I didn't watch TV or use the internet so no comment. I plan to go back to this hotel for my next Oriole game.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lesson Learned”
