Reviews.Author: Richy31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel this past weekend and I must say I am very impressed with the cleaniness of the rooms, the friendliness of the staff and overall wonderful experience. We are in Baltimore several times a year for football games and usually stay at the Marriott Camden Yards. Their prices for this past weekend were ridiculous and I refused to pay almost double a night from what they normally charge for one of their rooms. I priced and booked the Days Inn and could not have been happier. We have friends that always stay there and love it and now I know why. I will not, unless there is no other option, go back to paying much higher prices at the Marriott when my comfort level at the Days Inn was on par if not better. Compliments to a great staff and thank you for an enjoyable stay. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: sciguyinpa
Reviews.Content: Howdy. We stayed at this hotel for a recent conference at the convention center. The room I had was a bit small, but OK overall. Every hotel person we encountered was helpful, courteous and polite! Attached parking garage was not too bad at $20/day compared to other lots in the area. I had no problems with the pillows, but the matresses were a bit hard, in my opinion. Maybe 2 minutes to walk to the convention center, probably 6-7 minutes to walk to Camden Yards. About 15-20 minutes to the inner harbor attractions (aquarium, science center, etc). Fitness room was not stellar but not bad. Clean and spacious. elliptical and some treadmills and a weight machine of some kind. A few nearby restaurants (California Tortilla, Subway, plus some others we did not visit). Overall very pleased for the price. Could've paid more somewhere else, but not what we were looking to do on this trip. Currently there is a lot of streets department activity on the streets around the hotel, so be mindful of the traffic cones and such. Would stay here again-especially for convention center stuff!!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL GET-AWAY”
Reviews.Author: edcu77
Reviews.Content: Attended the USMC Birthday Ball at another hotel but decided to stay intown rather than drive the 30 miles home after the celebration. Hotel was a few short blocks from Baltimore's inner harbor. Hotel was up to date and staff was very helpful. Self parking immediately next door at $20.00 per night. (recently paid three times as much in Chicago). For an economical place to stay with all of the amenities that you look for, can't recommend this too highly.

Reviews.Title: “A place where you are treated with class”
Reviews.Author: terps83
Reviews.Content: Dennis We had a GREAT time in Baltimore. I appreciate all you did for me and my family. Our stay was wonderful. Your staff was outstanding especially Eric. Thanks again.. Tom Kelly

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Lena711
Reviews.Content: Location is great! walking distance to the harbor. Gerald at the front desk was very helpful! Rooms were "OK", good for the price ...the only BIG complaint I have is the drain system in the bathtub... you are standing in water to your ankles while showering. It takes about 30min for the water to go down...

Reviews.Title: “Great location with affordable price”
Reviews.Author: flocar
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference here and the hotel is right next door to the conference center. Close to shopping, lots of restaurants and sights to see. The staff were friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “chivalry is not dead - service was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: honey1015
Reviews.Content: arrived at hotel around 7 pm - greeted by Gerald - have not received such excellent service traveling in a long time - anything we needed or wanted to taken care of immediately with a pleasant smile. all staff were great, but gerald deserves recognition - he was outstanding. He advised anything I needed, just ask and he meant it. And staff were quite busy with checkins as there was a marathon the next day. Keep Gerald - he is an asset to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KatyBabyO
Reviews.Content: WOW! We were very impressed with this hotel and highly recommend anyone visiting Baltimore to stay at the Days Inn Inner Harbor. Our room was very clean with all the amenities we needed. The beds were very comfortable, I slept like a baby! The location was very conveinent as well.. everything we wanted to do was just around the corner or a cheap taxi ride away. We had a delicious breakfast in their restaurant and the staff in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. I truely feel we paid the best price for the best value. We will definately be returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST EVER, FALSE ADVERTISING, DIRTY,”
Reviews.Author: travelertoday_10
Reviews.Content: This was the worst ever and we do a lot of traveling. We were told at time of booking it comes with a complimentary breakfast and bottled water in the room. When we arrived we were told that is no longer the case. Honestly...worse than that was the old, dirty beds. My back is still sore from the mattress and the quilts should be thrown out NOW!! They were so dirty. Housekeeping never bought up the tissues and toilet paper that we needed and they said only "some rooms" get the bottled water. Never again will we stay in a Days Inn. I am too disappointed in the false advertising and the dirtiness of the place. It would have been worth it to pay more for a better stay somewhere else. Oh and the parking is 20.00 a day whether you stay there or not. It is no bargain like they advertise.

Reviews.Title: “Commitment to service - Thanks!”
Reviews.Author: 23yrroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Baltimore we ran into reservation scheduling issues which would have ruined the week as well as created some real headaches finding a place to stay. But Will (William Heiteer) and another staffer came to the rescue making our stay the best. He followed up to make sure our needs were met and the stay turned from hectic to blessed. The entire staff was great, the location fantastic and we highly recommend this Days Inn for all travelors. They truly are committed to service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: ruste60
Reviews.Content: I was surprisingly pleased with hotel, it was much cheaper in price then other hotels in the area. The Decor was nice and rooms were clean. The best thing about our stay was the convienence of Hotel to Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. We never moved our car until the day we left. Hotel staff was friendly and worked in a timely manner to check us in and out. We will be staying here the next time in town. Parking is not included in Price.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this Hotel, Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: midnitefrog
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely subpar. They had no air in the hotel and when we asked why it was so hot in the lobby, we were told "because it is hot outside and because of repaving the roads". Then in both of the rooms we had, the air stopped working for hours at a time and the heat was awful. Several times during our stay without warning the water went off for several hours and know one new when it would be back on. Once it was back on it was nasty brown water you wouldn't want to get on your skin. The bathrooms were the size of a postage stamp, you couldn't even turn around in there. They were doing some construction on one floor. The pool was closed and locked up the entire time we were there. Front desk service was very slow. Parking was $20 per day. Would not go back or reccommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “satisfied”
Reviews.Author: judyfromri
Reviews.Content: loved the location,room,staff and best of all the price.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach”
Reviews.Author: Ddac1982
Reviews.Content: After dropping our son off for school in DC we thought we would take a little side trip to Balitmore. Arriving in the evening the hotel looked clean and was a good price. After a great sleep and hot shower I was getting ready and saw a cockroach crawl around the fridge. With husband in the shower I took my trusty sandal and splat roach almost dead. The maintance man came up and took care of the critter and stated "that's the largest one I have seen". We were suppose to stay an extra night, but got out of the place in a hurry. We did get a refund and I also called corporate and was told that was not necessary by an office worker. Good thing I have always zipped up our suitcases when not in use. Never ever again for me. Ruined our nice vacation. We have NEVER had this problem before ever. I tried to load a picture of the insect but Trip Advisor doesn't allow it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected-Great location!”
Reviews.Author: soloonthego
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here while enroute to D.C. & was overall pleased..Been awhile since I had been to Baltimore, this is right in the heart of Camden Yards, easily accessible from BWI by light rail which has a station a block away near the baseball stadium..5min walk to the Babe Ruth Museum, Camden Yards & the Md. Sports Legend Museum..plenty of good restaurants within a few blocks walk as well, but try the hot wings & pizza at the hotel, you will be pleased. About 10mins by rail to Penn Station..easy check-in & check-out, got a decent rate of $79 on hotel.com..nice pool..room was typical of any other Days Inn..there was some construction going on at the hotel during my stay, little noisier during the day..microwave, small fridge in room..saw plenty of familie coming & going, seem to be good area of town, I had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: readem
Reviews.Content: I'm in Baltimore on business for about a week at least once each year. This place is perfect for me. The location is great, right across from the Convention Center and a short walk from the Inner Harbor. Lots of restaurants nearby (although the hotel restaurant is okay). Close to the ballpark if I want to take in a game. The place is clean and well maintained. Very secure. Pleasant and accommodating desk staff. Efficient housekeeping staff. Nice size room. Comfortable bed. Quiet. And . . . relatively inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay at for Marathon Runners.”
Reviews.Author: navywrslr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the DAYS INN for the last 2 years,I was running the Baltimore Marathon. This hotel was great, walking distance to every thing,inner harbor,stadiums,and the start/finish of the marathon. The service here is exceptional,the room was clean and roomy. I ate at the Resturant three times,and the food and service was fantastic. I highly recommend this Hotel to all marathon runners.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: rufustehshinra
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many of the hotels in Baltimore's Inner Harbor area and this is by FAR the best of them all! It had free WiFi, the parking was only $20 a night, the price was cheap, it was right by everything we needed to do, and the staff were amazingly friendly and helpful, unlike the Marriott next door which was twice as costly and by far the worst hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very friendly! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: fabricmage
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both over 50) plus 5 teenagers ( son, daughter & 3 friends) stayed July 29 - Aug 1 2010. We were there for a large anime convention and my expectations were not high. We've been going to this convention for many years and stayed in numerous other hotels at the Inner Harbor. This year, I decided to stay at the Days Inn so my kids could invite friends as we could get 2 rooms for about the same price as one room at another hotel. I'm happy to stay that our stay was very pleasant and I'll stay here again. Usually this convention stresses the staff as their are hoards of teenagers everywhere! The Days Inn staff was very friendly, very courteous and helpful. (They replaced keys, parking tickets, gave us more towels, cleaned the room when requested and quickly too!). The hotel is also right across from the convention center and easier to walk to than the attached hotels to the convention center (I have bad knees). Some negatives: beds are smaller (full size, I think), must leave parking garage by noon on checkout day or must pay regular rates ($3.50 per 1/2 hour) and street is very noisy (what do you expect in the middle of a city)? All in all, I will definitely book here again for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bztraveler23
Reviews.Content: I was just in Baltimore staying at another hotel and remembered that I forgot to review this one months ago. I was generally impressed with this hotel. I stayed here in February for a week to exhibit at the American Craft Council show at the Convention Center and the location couldn't have been better. The front desk staff was always very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. My only complaint is that the restaurant had horrible service on one occasion and very slow service on another, but considering I was there a week that's not too bad. The service was usually very good. I had very long hours at the show, and would want to have breakfast before and dinner and a drink after in the restaurant. One morning it took more than 40 minutes to get a simple bacon and eggs breakfast. I could not wait that long so I had to head to the show hungry. One night, the restaurant stopped serving food early because they had gotten too busy for the staff to handle. There were many empty tables by the time we arrived, so my friend and I decided to just order a bottle of wine for our room and some take out (from a local place). Our take out had been delivered long before the head waiter in the restaurant would not even look at us let alone stop at our table to take our order. We tried to place it with another waitress who was extremely nice, but she was unable to bring the wine for some reason the waiter had to do it. He seemed to be having a very bad night. I'd stay there again, but I'd have a back up plan for drinks and meals in case the bar/restaurant got backed up or had slow service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: travelinlife4me
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for the person looking for a decent room at a decent price in a good location. The small lobby and sitting areas are fine and I was treated well by every employee I encountered, especially the waiters at breakfast in their restaurant. The room was above average for this type of hotel, with plenty of room to work and a couch and coffee table. The bathroom is a little small, if that kind of thing matters to you. There's also a fridge and microwave and they left a bag of popcorn, a bottle of water and granola bar every morning. The room was well cleaned four out of the five nights of my stay. I attributed the less than steller job the other night to a change in housekeeper. It's a safe easy walk to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. There's a couple of little bars down the block and, of course, all the downtown restaurants. For the adventurus, take a walk to the World Famous Lexington Market on a Saturday morning. The area and crowd make look a little dicey to those not used to big city urban living, but it's perfectly safe. Treat yourself to some of the local food at great prices. There's nothing like standing at a counter and enjoying a crab cake and beer amongst the hustle and bustle at 10:30am. And don't forget the warm,fresh roasted peanuts at Konstant's outdoor stand. As a Baltimore native, who lived there most of my life,I've never seen so many policemen in the tourist area. There were almost two a block at night. So you should feel safe. Also, don't forget to head to the bar districts of Fells Point and my old neighborhood of Canton. So, save money on the pricier hotels and spread it around town a little.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richiekess
Reviews.Content: I am not one of those people who trashes things online for fun. That being said, stay away from this place. Long lines at check-in and check-out, plus while you are being taken care of at the counter they leave you hanging while they talk on the phone. It's rundown. And, it gets better: first, after a long wait to check in, they give me a room that's occupied. So, downstairs I have to go, back on the line for another long wait. Then the room the give me, at 11:30 pm, one of the hotel staff members starts banging on my door, asking who is in the room, and when I won't open the door, demands that I call the front desk to confirm who is actually staying in the room--meaning my name. Like that? The next day on check out, they tell me they had my name in the computer for another room entirely. And, all I got for all this was an apology. No offer to reduce costs or provide full refund which is what was warranted. Stay away from the place.

Reviews.Title: “Fine downtown accommodations”
Reviews.Author: famlyplanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in order to visit Inner Harbor and Camden Yards with our teens. We were able to get 2 rooms near each other on a lower floor as requested. Yes, the rooms are narrow and a little dated, with tube TVs and older bathrooms. But the beds were comfortable, the air controls were great and the rooms were well insulated from each other. I'm a light sleeper with allergies to mold mildew and mites. I fared much better at this hotel property than at higher priced chains. Parking was $20/day and conveniently located next to the hotel. The lobby area is very pleasant, with leather seating and a large flat screen TV. There is a nice coffee shop with muffins, etc in the lobby as well as a full service restaurant adjacent to the hotel. The elevators were fine and the staff were courteous and visible. Due to the small size of the rooms, I wouldn't stay here more than a few nights, but for a short stay, this is a great alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mdgirl86
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn in the Inner Harbor is a fantastic hotel! We stayed here over a very, very busy weekend and the Associates ran things smoothly and showed great examples of Customer Services. Everything and check-in and check-out ran smoothly, which in my opinion can make or break an experience. The Hotel is very conveniently located to the Converntion Center, Camden Yards and many other Inner Harbor attractions. The hotel has an outdoor pool, plently of parking and many other amenities. The rooms are well kept and very clean. We very much enjoyed our stay and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fitzgeraldrb
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in this property. Excellent location, a 2 minute walk to Camden Yards and a 10 minute walk to Inner Harbor. The rooms were clean, the bed very comfortable, first time in a long time didn't get up with a backache like I normally do from other properties. Hotel staff more than accomodating to your needs. Pool area was great, if a little small, restaurant was good but closed at 10PM, a little early in my opinion, ball games don't get out til at least that time but found a great place to eat right on the corner from hotel called Olivers. Great time, great location will stay there from now on when we go to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of their credit card fraud. Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ylda
Reviews.Content: This hotel fraudulently charged my credit card while I stayed there at the end of December. I stayed there in the end of December for two days. How I came to discover the hotel was that I found their offered rate on an online hotels website. Initially they refused the lower rate, but eventually they allowed it. I stayed two nights and received a receipt. Approximately a month later, I received a credit card statement that informed me that I stayed there two nights at a lower rate, and a third night at a higher rate (I only had stayed two nights). I attempted to contact the phone number for this hotel for billing issues (approximately 6 times over the course of 2 weeks) but I kept on getting a voicemail to leave a message. No one ever returned my phone call. Additionally, they did not return my e-mail about my dispute ([--] was the e-mail). I contacted my credit card company to file a complaint, and apparently the hotel responded by sending the credit card company a copy of a sales slip. Therefore, they essentially falsified that I stayed there for an extra night on a Monday, when I was actually working in New York City on that following weekday (I am a hospital employee). People may seem nice and friendly, but do not let their facade fool you. I really dislike people who are fake and try to take advantage of you and swindlers. I am not sure if they treat everyone this way, or if they are simply racist, because I am Asian. Therefore I highly advise people not to go to this hotel, perhaps until they change their staff to be composed of more honest people. Nothing annoys me more than businessmen who have deceptive practices. And pay attention to your credit card statements!

Reviews.Title: “Worst beds, tiny rooms, SLOW elevator -- this is no three star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wannatravelnow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn Inner Harbor last weekend for a volleyball tournament at the Baltimore Convention Center. The best thing I can say about this hotel is that it was close to where we needed to be. This was definitely no three star hotel. First of all, the beds were the most uncomfortable beds I have tried to sleep on and this was the consensus of all the parents of our club who stayed there. Everyone was walking around complaining of lower back pains all weekend. I did not sleep well either night I was there. The elevators took forever! My daughter's team was late for warmups because they had to wait so long for the elevator. The rooms were teeny tiny. I think next year I will try another hotel close to the convention center. Definitely not worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “A really great place to stay while visiting Baltimore and the inner harbor!”
Reviews.Author: SemperFi60
Reviews.Content: Everything about the place speaks of class. Not high-priced class, but friendly, helpful, and comfortable class. Prices are very competitive, and everything we wanted to see was within easy walking distance. And the hotel staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. As you visit the Inner Harbor attractions, be sure to take advantage of the new Charm City Circulator bus routes--free rides that pass very close to the hotel and the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: deepblusea4ever
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! Only a few stories high, decorated nicely, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Every room has a microwave and a refrigerator, along with an easy-to-use safe. My conference was a few blocks away ($5 cab ride), but the Days Inn was half the price! I highly recommend this hotel, and I plan on using it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Accommodations - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SharpestJim
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable room. Stay was booked for me by corporate but I was pleasantly surprised. Perfect location directly across street from Baltimore Convention Center. Just a short walk to the shops and entertainment of the Inner Harbor area. And only a mile or so walk to Little Italy (love that Italian food!). Considering that it is right in the middle of town, it can be a little noisy at times (sirens, dumpsters dumping, etc.), but you get that in any large city (I wear earplugs for sleeping anyway). The rooms could stand to be upgraded, I suppose, but they're spacious and clean. You do have to pay for coffee downstairs but it's excellent (Seattle's Best) but at least the internet is free - and it works. The staff is very friendly, too - especially Jaime at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service in the poorest maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLERUNLIMITE
Reviews.Content: After checked in on Tuesday at 5 pm., the desk clerk said: "by the way the hot water is out and should be fixed within the next hour". No sign of ANY water by 10 pm, called the front desk. he said: "It is almost done". At 6 am the next day, still no hot water. Called the front desk. This time another person answered the phone and when I asked for the status of hot water, he said: "Hey you are not the only one, we do not have any hot water any where in the hotel". " I ask what should I do, instead of apologizing, he answered: " I do not know. What do you want me to do about it"." Left the hotel and went to a friends house, showered and continued with my business all day. Got back to the hotel room that evening. This time there was no water period, cold or hot. Tried to check out, the person at the desk said, we can not give you refund since it is a prepaid room. But we will have water soon. I stayed with friends that evening. Back to the hotel the next morning and while tuning my key in. I noticed a lady in front of me also was trying to check out two days earlier, but they have already charged her credit card for four night of parking even though she had stayed only two and wanted to check out earlier due to lack of hot water and apparently a filthy room. The desk clerk keep saying that the we do not own the parking and your card has already been charged. NO REFUND, NO APOLOGY OR REGRETS BY ANY ONE AT THE HOTEL. They also charged me two night parking, and "safe in the room" fee.

Reviews.Title: “Totally awesome place and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: bubbyNY
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore for a convention and was staying elsewhere. After having a miserable night I decided to seek out another place to stay. The Baltimore Vistors Center was GREAT and called the Days Inn getting me a VERY REASONABLE rate. I had a ton of luggage and was in conferences all day so I checked at 7am on the day I was checking in to see if I would leave my luggage there while I was in conference. The staff was awesome and happily checked me into my room at no extra charge. At the business center, I was able to print my boarding pass and catchup on my email. The staff was totally friendly and spent the entire evening guiding guests to restaurants that had quality food and atmosphere in a desired price range. Upon checking out, the staff asked my if I wanted them to store my luggage while I was at my last day of conference. This was the most thoughtful, friendly, helpful hotel staff I have ever encountered. I will never forget this!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale feel and location yet affordable”
Reviews.Author: misspadraigin
Reviews.Content: I travel often to Baltimore for medical visits to Johns Hopkins Hospital. I was thrilled to find this Days Inn, within walking distance of the Inner Harbor and an easy drive (and taxi voucher service) to the hospital. They offer a special rate for Hopkins patients, which makes frequent stays affordable. The room was small but brightly-lit, clean, with comfy beds and bedding, good shower, fridge and microwave. Nicely decorated everywhere. Parking next door with bridge to the hotel. Nice restaurant and coffee bar. Pet friendly with refundable cleaning fee. Friendly, attentive staff. Great experience, which I will be repeating over the next few months.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel near the convention center and inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: arizonaswimmom
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly even though they were booked solid with convention and marathon guests. The room was very clean. Thankfully all rooms are non smoking! The hotel was across the street from the convention center which made it super convenient. The night manager Gerald Salgado and his staff were great at giving suggestions for activities and dining around the area. The only downside to the hotel is that there's only 2 elevators which make it difficult during peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: babyosa724
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it is close to all atractions. Rooms were clean and the staff was very nice and friendly. We will probably stay at the Days Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: conary
Reviews.Content: What I liked most about the Days Inn Inner Harbor was the friendliness of the staff. This started with the front-desk manager who was absolutely trying to make my stay a pleasant one. I felt appreciated and welcome as a guest. You can't really say that for a lot of hotels these days. All other staff members I came in contact with were helpful and polite. My room was very spacious and comfortable, it had everything I needed including free wi-fi that also worked. The fitness center was pretty basic, but the treadmill worked great and I was able to get my work out in for the day. I also had breakfast (not included in my rate), and it was good and I didn't have to wait too long for it. I liked that they had complimentary copies of USA today to read while waiting for the food. All in all, I would stay at this hotel again and I can recommend it to anyone who is looking for a clean, comfortable place to spend the night close to inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “I have only good things to say about this hotel & the staff”
Reviews.Author: AnniePortland_Maine
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this place. Every staff member was welcoming and friendly, going above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. The room was clean and comfortable, the restaurant had great food, and the hotel itself is charming and within walking distance to the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged”
Reviews.Author: Dinkoh
Reviews.Content: My wife was on business trip (conference) and I accompanied her. We were quoted $129 for a double room and stayed for 4 nights and half a day. We checked out and she paid with her corporate credit card total of $726.03. After checking her statement online back home, my wife realized she was overcharged $873.45, send few emails to the hotel asking for the reason but never got any reply. Her finance department disputed that payment and hotel charged my private visa card for the same amount of $873.45 even thou I never authorized it. I am now waiting for my bank to dispute that payment. I will never stay in that hotel again and tell to all our friends in Australia to stay away from hotel that charge you one amount and than change it mind and overcharge you. We still have tax invoice for the $726.03 my wife paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value at Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: PAlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Days Inn at Inner Harbor in August. I had called ahead and asked for a room in a "quiet section - away from the elevator and the ice/vending machines". Arrived early - 12:30 and thought we would at least fill out paperwork. Was surprised that the room was ready. (It was a Thursday so that might be why). We were put on the 9th floor away from the elevator and machines and facing Hopkins Place (main entrance). We faced buildings across the street and did hear the occasional ambulance and fire sirens but I think because we were on the upper floor, it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. The room was spotless and looked relatively new. The carpet and furniture were in excellent shape. The room was very hot and we turned on the air. I was nervous that it might not be working so called and asked for maintenance to check it out. Within minutes a maintenance man arrived, checked it over and reassured me it was a new unit and the room would cool off. He waited to make sure it went through a cycle. He was polite and friendly. We left to go to the harbor and when we returned the room was very cool. I called for a roll away and it was delivered. Called down to ask for pillows and an extra blanket and they were delivered within an hour. (blanket was new and in plastic wrapping) The room had 2 beds and getting the roll away did make it cramped. We put the rollaway next to the bed and the window. (and had to put a pillow against part of the air conditioning unit so my niece would not get too cold) She said the roll away was comfortable. The staff are extremely polite, and friendly. I found the front desk staff were efficient, and the general staff were very nice. The beds were comfortable and the room was cleaned well each of the days we stayed (3 nights). The bathroom was small and the sink is outside. The lighting is not great for putting on your makeup so I used the desk as a vanity and the light there was great. The room has a coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator. All worked well. The room was done in forest greens, beige and brown. Not bright colors but attractive. The halls were done in a cream and green and very well lit. There is a small take out area with coffee and snacks to purchase (including small bottles of wine and beer) by the front desk area. We did eat in the hotel on Sunday and had the buffett. The server was very attentive. The kids buffett was $4.99, adults was alittle over $12. It was a deal for the kids but in hindsight I would have ordered off the menu but I was in a hurry and didn't want to wait. Buffet included eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes,muffins, toast, cereal. Buffet also includes coffee, juice. The pool (outside) is staffed by a lifeguard but is only open to 8. It is small but was ok for our purposes. Parking is adjacent to the hotel and is $20 a day. You need to take your ticket to the front desk and they process it so you can have in and out priviledges. Final charges go on your credit card unless you make other arrangements. The garage is not owned by the hotel but was clean, and well lit. There is a safe in the room and there is a $1 a day charge for it. Well worth the piece of mind. We enjoyed our stay and I would definately return there when going to the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Perfect Location, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MurphyNh
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms through Expedia for approx. $80/night. We were very happy with the rooms, location was great since we were in town for Inner Harbor and Orioles game and general sight seeing. Breakfast buffet was very good but limited.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short trip to Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyAmyj
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms here through Expedia for around $90 per room per night for a Saturday to see an O's game with friends and do a little Baltimore sight seeing. Check in was very smooth, even though there were a decent number of people checking in when we arrived. Parking was very easy in the garage behind the hotel, and $20 to park to me seems reasonable for a garage in a city. Our rooms were very clean and comfy, though the bathrooms are very small. The rooms overlooked the pool (which is small but looked very clean), so it was nice and quiet at night. The beds were comfortable and room was big enough for 2 people, though it might be cramped with more. The hotel is a few blocks from the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards, which is a GREAT location. The area seemed very safe and well lit. Overall, this hotel is an average hotel...the staff is fine, the location is fine, the rooms are fine. If you are staying in Baltimore for one or two nights and are not looking for luxury, this place is perfect for you. I'd definitely stay here again for a return trip to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “great rates + great weekend”
Reviews.Author: justenuff
Reviews.Content: I stay here with my sons, and we had no problems. We parked the car and walked everywhere! Very convenient (and safe) walk to the Inner Harbor. It would be nice to have a free continential breakfast and slash the parking fee. I will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: WoodMan77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Days Inn Inner Harbor May 8-9. Was in town for the Yanks O's Game Friday and Saturday. The hotel was easy to get to. Check in was easy and quick even though the place was fully booked with the Yanks in town. Staff was friendly and courteous. Room was pretty standard, with microwave and small fridge. Also some tourist/travel brochures with maps and attractions which I found helpful having never been to Baltimore. Stayed on the second floor near the corner of the building. The bar next door plays very loud music until early in the morning that you can clearly hear in the room. This didn't bother me, but I could see how it might bother some people. The room seemed clean, the only complaint was a faint smell of moth balls. The elevator seemed a little slow, but being on the second floor I just used the stairs. The location was great. About half way between Oriole Park and the Inner Harbor or a 5 min walk to both. The prices compared to the hotels that are actually in the Inner Harbor are unbeatable and wortth the 5 min walk. Parking was $20 a day at the garage next door. I didn't have any problems but saw in another review that a hotel guests car was broken into. I did see the police investigating a break in in the garage after checking out. However, this isn't the hotels fault, things like that happen in all major cities. Use common sense and don't leave anything valuable in your car! I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel-----5 star customer service”
Reviews.Author: cv529
Reviews.Content: We were in town to see the May 9 baseball game (O's vs Yankees) and spent the night at the Days Inn-Inner Harbor. Let me start by saying the hotel was booked solid. Most hotels are on the weekends when the Yankees are in town. The lobby was packed at check in but the line moved fast and the staff was efficient and friendly. After reading prior posts I requested a room on the opposite side of the parking garage. Great suggestion. Room was nice spacious and quiet. Fridge, micowave oven, pod coffee maker, complimentary bottle of spring water, microwave popcorn and a granola bar was a nice touch. Car was parked in the attached garage at 20.00 a day. Seemed secure. After checking out this morning we got to the car and found the window smashed and small things like cds and toll money taken. I sent my daughter to get the hotel manager not realizing at the time that the parking facility is not affiliated with the hotel. The hotel manager, William Heitzer, was a true professional and I am sending a letter to the general manager tomorrow to let know know of my experience. Again, let me emplasize that the hotel is NOT affiliated with the attached parking garage. William went above and beyond to help with everything. He called the police and the garage clerk, offered us a complimentary breakfast while we waited for the police. After the police left he went with me to submit my incident report to the garage clerk, refunded my parking fee and had a nice gentleman from maintnence vacume the glass and tape plastic onto my window. Wow. True customer service. Will I stay here again?....absolutely Will I park in the garage again....most likely...but with a lesson learned....keep nothing in the car (they even took the pennies that i had!) and put a sign on the window letting the bad guys know not to waste their time with this car....its empty.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure there is not a concert the night you stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sioux1
Reviews.Content: Went down for a convention and the location of this hotel is fantastic. It is within walking distance (less than a block) from the actual convention center. Everything was great except there is a parking garage next to the hotel and if you get that side of the hotel and there is a concert that night it will be a nightmare. Apparently there is a concert venue that shares their parking garage and from 12:15 to 1:15am the cars were all piling out of the garage, beeping, radios blaring, police sirens going and people screaming the entire time. We booked the hotel on Expedia and not directly from the Days Inn so that MAY be the reason we got the "parking garage" side of the building. But I was very upset since I was down there on business and didn't get much sleep. If you go there make sure you ask to be on the opposite side of the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Gloomy, overpriced, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: GucciLittlePiggie
Reviews.Content: We got stuck in Raleigh with car trouble, and we picked this as the cheapest 3-star hotel on Expedia so we didn't have to start a 10.5 hour drive at 3pm. We paid 90 (not bad), but this hotel was valued at 160 and rated 3 stars. It is definitely 2 or 2.5 stars, as it is very, very old, dark, and dated. It reminds me of something you'd see homicide detectives bursting into in some 1980s police movie. The bed was so saggy I almost fell on the floor trying to sit on it. It was listed as a queen, but was just a double. Even with all the lights on, the room was depressingly dark. The elevator, decor, bathrooms, and even public areas are incredibly old looking. On the plus side it was clean enough, had a mini-fridge and microwave, and the staff was friendly. I figured that was all I needed, except that all night long I was awakened by traffic (9th floor), and the room was freezing (no thermostat, only a sub-window mounted AC+heat that smelled like death when it was on, which turned off in the night). Oh yes, they also billed me 18 bucks to park myself at a privately owned garage, the same rate the garage itself charged.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but decent”
Reviews.Author: walkersc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because my wife had been here about a year ago and they had the cheapest rate online that I could find. Also stayed at a Days Inn near Boston this summer and really liked it. Hotel was smack dab in the middle of downtown Baltimore. Couple of wrong turns and then we found it. Parking is next door in a garage, which costs $18 a day. The room was very small - nothing like the pictures on the Days Inn website nor the hotel in Boston. We had two doubles. Bathroom had one room for shower and toilet, and the sink was in the hallway. Bathroom was very tight and lighting was awful (energy-saving white light). Everything was pretty clean, beds were nice and comfy, and there was a desk and an armoire with TV in it - the standard. Hotel was quiet. The lobby is also small, with a small coffee shop (no free food or breakfasts). The staff was very, very nice as everyone has said. We kept our car in the garage while we toured the Inner Harbor (about a 10 minute walk away), and upon leaving I attempted to pay the $10 parking fee (we owed for an hour after the noon checkout time). The machine wouldn't take it, so I went in to the front desk and the woman validated my ticket for me so I didn't owe the $10 - nice! They had a concierge on-duty, and the staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is great!”
Reviews.Author: balletmom21
Reviews.Content: The location is great! The lobby, room and staff are great! They actually had common sense-rare these days! Experienced a miserable night of lying awake all night until 7am because of extremely noisy neighbors who also attempted to get to our room via the adjoining room door! !! Pretty concerning event! The evening desk clerk sent security up to ask them to be quiet after we went downstairs to complain. Actually, that is the only part we felt could have been handled differently because they continued having guests in their room, slamming the door, etc. until 7am. The security could have been a bit firmer rather than saying "We need to ask you to be quiet-sorry to have interrupted your evening". Sorry to have interrupted your evening??!! WE were the ones inconvenienced from lack of sleep and he was being polite to THEM??!! Could have been a bit stronger in the approach because we paid a lot of money for the room and could have slept cheaper and quieter in our car! Other patrons of the hotel knocked on the occcupants door also asking for them to be quiet. The nice thing was that he waited until we got in our room (after we went downstairs to complain) before he approached the occupants of the other room-we were afraid there would be more retribution after they attempted to get in our room through the adjoining door! The next morning we asked to be moved to another room on another floor and Gerald could not have been nicer or more accommodating! He asked us what floor we would prefer and that the room would be ready for us. We moved our luggage (he explained it is a policy that at least one member of the party be there when the rooms are being swtiched which is understandable) and he was just genuinely sorry for the inconvenience of the situation. He took the time to talk with us, sympathize and handled the matter very concisely and expediantly. Good go, Gerald! The cleaning staff were friendly and smiling and we never felt that we were in their way even when walking in the hall! When moving to the other room, the room key wouldn't work and a man with the master key heard of the situation and let us in the room so that we didn't have to go back down to the main desk, get a key and come back up! He told us to go down to the main desk and tell them the key wasn't working. I stayed in the room, my husband went to the main desk. It could have been one more clog in the wheel to making a bad stay at the hotel but his common sense in the matter changed the situation! The help of the concerned staff made an otherwise terrbile situation more bearable. No blame on the staff-they are GREAT-would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY - EMPLOYEES HELPFULL”
Reviews.Author: REDEYE19782
Reviews.Content: I would just like to write to you to let you know what fine employees that are working at the Days Inn Inner Harbor. My wife and I stayed August 24-25 and our stay was very exceptional. We are from South Carolina and I had an appointment to see two different Doctors in Baltimore. We flew in early on the 24th. Our room was not ready yet, but we got to leave our luggage and catch a baseball game. I needed to go to Pikesville for one of my appointments and I called the transit system for information on how to get there. They told me to catch bus #7 to Mondawin Station and then catch M2 to Old Court Road. When I talked to some people that we met there in Baltimore they told me not to get off at Mondawin Station, that it was too dangerous. They told me to catch a taxi. I called the Taxi service for a price and they told me $80.00 roundtrip. Everyone at Days Inn Inner Harbor was very helpful, especially Ms. Jamie Fisher. I asked her for her input and she told me to ride the Metro to Old Court Station then catch the M2 to Old Court Road. That worked out so good for me. And it saved me a lot of money. Ms. Fisher was always smiling and very helpful to us. She dresses like a professional and acts like a professional. Most places you go to anymore, employees just don’t care about the customer. But Ms Fisher showed me that she cares for her customers. And that is why we will come back to Days Inn Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Gloomy hotel with many good points”
Reviews.Author: andy2840
Reviews.Content: My company chose this hotel for me because it had the cheapest rate going in downtown Baltimore. This looks like one of the brown brick Days Inns you might see out on the highway...except perhaps a bit taller. It looks kind of out of place in the Baltimore skyline. The plus of that is the convenient short term parking out front while checking in. You have to pay to park in the covered garage attached to the rear of the hotel after you've checked in; the rate was about $18; that may seem like a lot but it's good for downtown. There is very easy access to 395, so you can get in and out of the city quickly. The hotel is gloomy on the inside as well as the outside. The decor features lots of tan and brown. I found the halls to be dimly lit. The rooms are similarly dark and depressing. However they are clean, if a little worn. My room had scuffed furniture, mildew stains (just stains, not mildew) and some burn marks on the sink. The linens were frayed as well. But I have no complaints about the housekeeping; it was regular and thorough. My room was also very quiet (I was on a higher floor but the windows did seem to be soundproof, so lower floors might be OK too). DON'T believe the "3 blocks to Harbor Place" hype. It's 3 blocks if you count the Convention Center as one block, even though it spans several blocks. It's more like 4 or 5 blocks to the Harbor, and at night they are long, lonely blocks; I didn't feel unsafe, but some might. It is, however, very convenient to the Convention Center, also near Camden Yards. I found the service to be friendly, helpful and courteous. The staff seemed very solicitous of my needs during my stay. The on-site restaurant had high prices and mediocre quality. I would avoid it in favor of the many good restaurants in Baltimore. There is a pool on the ground floor, right at street level. It is separated from the street by a brick screen. You can hear (and partially see) rush hour traffic while you swim. I probably wouldn't choose this hotel again unless the price advantage was better than $20 versus other hotels in the area. I would definitely not recommend this hotel for those with mental illness or who are prone to suicide; this place might put them over the edge!

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Inner Harbor - gave away my reserved room”
Reviews.Author: Samatva
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at Days Inn Inner Harbor, Baltimore, MA, in March, 2008, online for 3 nights in mid-June. I confirmed in early June. I e-mailed the address on their web site about a week ahead to alert them that I had a late flight and would be arriving after midnight. The reply e-mail said I needed call the day of arrival. Although I thought that my e-mail *should* have been enough notice, I called before boarding my flight to let them know I would arrive between midnight and 1am. They said "OK." When I arrived at Days Inn, an angry-looking man was being escorted to a taxi by the desk agent. When he returned to the desk, the agent told me "I have some good news and some bad news: The good news is that you won't have to pay for your room tonight. The bad news is that it isn't here." I told him that there was no good news: I wasn't paying for my room anyway - I was on the job for the state of Georgia. I was being sent to the Mt Vernon Inn, "about six blocks north" (more like 8) and that I could come back to the Days Inn the next day. I complained that the Mt Vernon Inn was considerably further from my conference location - he gave me a total of $15 for taxi fare. I was also given a letter to give to Mt Vernon and was escorted out to a waiting rattle-trap taxi. At the Mt Vernon, I caught up with the aforementioned angry man - he had been booted from his reservation too. While the Mt Vernon was older and not as nice as the Days Inn, I decided to stay and negotiated to get the room for all three nights for the same rate that Days Inn paid for the first night ($99 vs $155 market or $122 govt employee rate). The extra walking was only a bit of a hassle (esp the last day w/luggage) and the neighborhood a bit "more interesting" - the REAL problem is being booted out of my room so late the night before having to give a presentation at the conference. Shortly after canceling my room via phone, I did stop by the Days Inn. The front desk manager was very apologetic and said they felt bad about it. I was NEVER given an explanation of what happened. I do know that a national extreme sports competition was in town that weekend, so I'm certain that I just lost out to the highest bidder.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Hotel, Right Next To The Ballpark”
Reviews.Author: cps102
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on a trip to New York. The room was your average two queen bed, bathroom, tv, coffemaker, etc. It was a nice resting area. The breakfast in the morning was a little pricey, but the dining area outside was nice touch to the good breakfast. Went to the Orioles game, and it was a easy couple-block walk to and from the hotel to the park. If I ever want to go to an Orioles game, this is the hotel I'd stay at. Good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience at Days Inn Baltimore Inner Harbor, MD”
Reviews.Author: kangleli
Reviews.Content: Do not expect you will get it back if you left something nice in this hotel, at least it was my experience! I stayed at this hotel with my husband for two nights last week. When we checked out, I forgot to pack a very nice dress and a blouse which goes well with the dress. Both items were in a white clean laundry bag which I left on the bed. As soon as I realized I forgot to pack the bag after I returned home in VA, I called the hotel. During the following two days I called several times and talked to the hotel staff at the front desk and house keeping. Each time I was told they would check with the hotel's Lost and Found, and then call me back, they never did. Yesterday I finally got someone at front desk agreed to go to the Lost and Found to check while putting me on hold. He came back in a few minutes and said he did not find the dress or the blouse. I cannot believe the cleaning people changing bed sheets did not see the bag. Maybe there is no incentive for them to turn in nice things accidentally left by guests. Lessons learned - never stay at this kind of hotels again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: LocalFBI
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a group block of 10 rooms at this hotel. Jennifer, the sales associate was terrific and extremely helpful in recommending contacts for ground transportation and groups sales tickets at the Orioles. Thanks to her we had GREAT club level seats and comfortable ground transport. I must admit, I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the rooms in this hotel. Jennifer did inform me that the hotel had recently undergone renovations, but I continued to think of Days Inn as a 1-2 star hotel - not this one though!. The rooms were very neat and clean. The decor made me felt akin to a Marriott (where I usually try to stay). All of the guests in my group had positive comments about their rooms, which included a queen bed, couch & coffee table, desk, and dorm size fridge & microwave! I thought there was ample space for all of these things. In the am we enjoyed the full breakfast at the restaurant. This included fruit, pastry, bacon, eggs, sausage, cereal, yogurt and pancakes. Food was good. Overall, this hotel was extremely well priced for the location and accommodations. I would highly recommend it for families. It is 2 blocks from the baseball stadium and about 4 blocks from the inner harbor - all easily within walking distance. I will definitely consider this hotel the next time I'm in the area! The only negative that I experienced was that the TV in the room was an older model and the color and images on the screen were not as sharp as I'd like. Group rate $189 during Red Sox game weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gbpell
Reviews.Content: After reseaching different hotels on Tripadvisor, I decided to book the Days Inn Inner Harbor for a 3 day "tourist" vacation. I was very happy with my choice. Check in was a breeze, staff was friendly and helpful and the location couldn't be beat-just three short blocks to the harbor. Our room was very clean and big enough for the purpose it served. The bathroom was spotless, no mold around the tub and plenty of towels. The coffee pot, microwave and fridge was an extra bonus. You do get charged $1.00 a day for the safe but that was no biggie. There were 4 pillows on the bed (queen size), 2 are soft, 2 are hard, that's a choice I never had in other hotels. My only complaint about the room was that you couldn't open the windows for some fresh air. My AAA rate of $152 a day was very reasonable considering what other hotels in the area get. We ate breakfast everyday at the hotel for convenience. Food was good, nothing great, just typical breakfast fare. All in all, I thought the hotel was excellent and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “My April 08' visit..”
Reviews.Author: kwible21
Reviews.Content: Pros The front desk was very helpful and friendly! It mostly seemed pretty clean! Cons They give you little three little bottles with shampoo/Cond. and lotion, although ours were used and half empty. The coffee maker was broken! There were were black hairs all over the bathroom and in the towels, thats a huge problem for me so I didn't end up showering there which I wanted to. Although this is called Days Inn Inner Harbor, its several blocks away from the inner harbor, I thought it was closer! No free breakfast - most Days Inn offer that! 18 dollars to park your car for 1 day!

Reviews.Title: “Wow...my jaw is on the floor...”
Reviews.Author: HoopyKat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inner Harbor Days Inn when I attended an EMS conference in March. I had attended this conference previously, and had stayed at the Hyatt (*bleagh*) and the Sheraton (not bad). This year I was planning the trip on a budget, and that left the Days Inn. Wow. Was I surprised. On my arrival the staff was friendly and accommodating. Check-in was a breeze, the lobby was intimate and immaculate. The entire hotel is NON-SMOKING...yes!! $200 a day fee if you're caught pollut...er....smoking in your room. There are only 2 elevators, but compared to the sloth-like lifts at the Hyatt, these were bullet trains. The room was small but spotless and inviting. Two full beds, newish mattress sets that were quite comfortable to sleep on, and no questionable stains on the quilts. Bathroom was smallish, with a commode and tub...sink and mirror were in the room in another niche next to the closet alcove. The shower was great; good pressure and you didn't have to wait a year for hot water. The room included a small fridge and a microwave; the Sheraton and Hyatt did not. Nice touch, if you ask me. The closet was an alcove without a door for your hanging items, the iron and ironing board, but hey...didn't bother me. Typical TV/armoire setup, with typical hotel channel choices, and pay-per-view movies (no I didn't watch any porn!) One of the nicest perks is FREE in-room wireless Internet access. That's right....FREE! Costs $10 a day at the other, more expensive places, and the free service was much faster! There is a nice desk to surf the Web from. The in-hotel restaurant was good too; typical hotel-inflated prices but the food was yummy. Free USA Today if you want to get dressed and go down to the front desk and grab one. In-room pod coffee maker worked great, and the coffee didn't suck either. The pool was covered due to winter, but the workout room was nicely appointed. Self park for $18 a day (cheaper than the other places by $2/day); bring your ticket to the front counter to get it activated so you can come and go as you please by inserting it into the gate machines in the garage. ATM in the hotel lobby too. Easy walking distance to Camden Yards, Metro Station, the Convention Center, and Inner Harbor attractions, even for a chubby chum like me. Street noise isn't too bad, although there must be a Fire Station near, as sirens were audible quite often. Minuses: ice machine on my floor was broken initially; fixed in a day. Candy machine ate another guest's money-it was also fixed quickly. Prices for the vending items were the same as you'd find at the local CVS...not inflated like the other hotels. Also, one wall outlet in my room was dead, but only a minor inconvenience. I highly recommend this hotel especially if you're just looking for a comfortable place to sleep while you visit the Inner Harbor area. Save money by not staying at the other, higher priced locales.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: wjstpb
Reviews.Content: Unusually well kept, clean, friendly, modern Days Inn. I expected the basics only and was surprised with a clean hotel room, modern furnishings, terrific service, and a very good restaurant. Great place to stay if you want to walk to all of the attractions at Inner Harbor but don't want to pay a lot for a hotel room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for one night/Orioles Game”
Reviews.Author: gails09
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip to see Orioles/Red Sox game. As always hotel availability is low and cost high during these series so was surprised to find this hotel at $188 AAA rate on 24 hours notice. Not a big fan of Days Inn, but would be in Baltimore only about 15 hours and had low expectations. Check-in was very fast, parking convenient, everything clean and efficient. Room and decor of common areas far above usual Days Inn quality. Very convenient to Camden Yards but a little further from actual Inner Harbor than one might want for a longer trip. (about 4 blocks). No complaints for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for Camden Yds/ Convention Ctr”
Reviews.Author: brooke06
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night while I was in town for a baseball game. I wasn't expecting much based on previous Days Inn stays, but this place was perfect. It was only 5 mins walk from Camden Yards and 5 mins from the Inner Harbor. It is directly across the street from the Convention Ctr. The rate was much better than any other hotel I could find in the area of the stadium( half the price of the other hotels- Our rate was $129). It is a very easy drive from the major highways. Parking is in a garage directly behind the hotel, at a rate of $18 per day. We arrived early and no rooms were available but we were able to park and they stored our luggage for us. The room itself was small but fine for one night. The bathroom was particularly small, with the sink/vanity out in the room. If you are staying for a long time with a lot of luggage the size of the room could be a problem. We had a micro/fridge combo in the room which was good. Our room was on the first floor, near the main entrance, so I was worried about noise but I didnt hear anything during the night. I took note to the other 'camden yards' hotel locations and while they were a little closer to the stadium, they are all behind the stadium and therefore a further walk to Inner Harbor. This place was a great deal and fantastic location and I will keep it in mind for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Inner Harbor....could be better, could be worse......”
Reviews.Author: green_turtle_13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn Inner Harbor the weekend of August 4th because we were in town for the Virgin Music Festival...which was awesome!! As for the hotel: Accessability: It was easy to find with directions we printed from Mapquest. It is a great location, within walking distance to just about everything including the Metro/Subway which is what we took to the festival and that too was easy to navigate. Parking: It is right next door in a parking garage, which I do not believe is owned by the hotel. I think it is a little crazy that they make their guests pay for parking. You pay over-exaggerated rates to stay downtown and closer to inner-harbor, the least they can do is include the parking in the room rate....because they also do not include a continental breakfast like most hotels do. Rooms: we requested a NON-SMOKING room and there was not an ashtray in sight, but the smell when you walked in the door could of knocked you over. I think that if a hotel has designated non-smoking rooms they should enforce that policy for those said rooms because there are people out there who do prefer to sleep in a hotel room that does not smell of stale cigarettes. However, we were late getting to the festival and decided not to switch rooms and to just get on with our day and why we were in B-town to begin with....the concert. :o) The rooms were pretty standard. We had a queen bed, sofa and coffee table and side table and tv and armoire. They also provide you with a small refrigerator and microwave (probably why breakfast in not included either). They did have a coffee pot that distributed coffee directly into a mug, but unfortunately we weren't give any coffee mugs so we didn't get to use that for our morning caffeine fix. The beds are hard....so be prepared for that. The sink is outside of the bathroom so it is easy for two people to get ready at the same time. Room Service: we ordered room service and it was pretty good. However, be warned that they do include the 18% gratuity to the bill and their prices on their menu do not always match the prices that you are charged....just a warning. Not sure if we would stay here again, probably stay somewhere else or maybe just make a day trip up to Inner Harbor if we were to return again. Like I said....it could be better, it could be worse. Happy and Safe Travels!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Days at Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: sedonababe
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about the location since I traveled by train, and didn't rent a car. However, everything worked out fine. It is only a 10 minute cab ride from Amtrak, and 2 blocks to the Maryland Light Rail at Camden Yards. In the opposite direction was Inner Harbor, about 3-4 blocks. Check in was quick and efficient. The front desk rep was very friendly and asked if I needed directions to attractions. The room itself was clean. Had microwave, refridgerator, and coffee maker. (The coffee didn't taste good however.) My only gripe was the bathroom. My room was a handicap-accessible one. I am not handicapped, it was the only room available. I noticed the handrails (good) low toilet(good), and very high sink. Someone correct me, but should a sink be chest high for a wheelchair accessible room? And the tiles need to be redone. Their age is showing. Otherwise it was a great place to stay, and would certainly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel78
Reviews.Content: I was part of a youth group (26 people total) who arrived at the Days Inn just as most people were checking out on a game day Saturday morning. We had reservations and the hotel was completely booked, so there were LOTS of people milling around. The desk staff were all polite, efficient, and knowledgeable, as were the waitresses and cleaning folks who we asked for lunch and shopping recommendations for our large group of teenagers. Everyone was eager to please. We had all 10 of our rooms within 30 minutes of our arrival and we were there 3 hours early! The hotel is well-decorated, clean, and comfortable. The rooms have a sink, mirror, and hairdryer separate from the toilet and shower. The bathroom even has an exhaust fan! The beds were extremely comfortable and the a/c worked very well. The hotel is three blocks from the Inner Harbor and three blocks from Camden Yards. We had a very bad experience the previous week at a Sheraton in DC so this was a welcome relief. Great hotel, staff, and service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one or two nights, probably not anymore, though.”
Reviews.Author: BJMSZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. For that amount of time it was perfect. For a week stay in Baltimore, it isn't very practical. But... *Room* - the room was average. The size was fine for four people. Two queen size beds were in our room. It was clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was extremely small. But, a fridge and microwave oven came in the room with no extra fee. This was a very great added bonus. A few things broke, but they were quickly and efficiently. replaced and/or fixed. Overall, the room gets 6/10 stars. *Lobby* - the lobby was, again, average. There was a large sitting area, but overall, the lobby was pretty small. No place you want to spend all your time in! There were many resources, such as brochures and maps to get in the lobby. Overall, the lobby gets 6/10 stars. *Service* - the service was excellent. Staff was a huge help in finding things to do and getting directions for us. They were very willing to help and excellent helpers. The quickly and efficiently replaced and/or fixed our broken things in our room. Overall, the staff gets 8/10 stars. *Pool* - the pool was, once again, average. It was small, but we were one of the few ones there. It was clean, though, and a lifeguard looked over us. However, it was extremely cold because it was the beginning/middle of June and it was between two large, tall buildings, so it was shaded and did not get a lot of sun. You probably do not want to go swimming unless you like the cold, it is really hot out, or it is in July or August. Overall, the pool gets 6/10 stars. *Restaurant* - the restaurant seemed nice, but we did not go in it. It was fairly expensive and there is NO free breakfast. The menu seemed pretty good, but we have no idea how good the food was. Overall, we are not going to rate the restaurant because we do not feel informed enough to do so. *Location* - the inner harbor was about 3 or 4 blocks away if you go in the right, correct direction. It was a nice, short walk that was very pleasurable. We did not encounter any problems at all, whatsoever. Overall, the location gets 7/10 stars. Overall, the hotel was fairly nice and we might stay here again, but only for 2 or 3 nights, at tops. The hotel gets 33/50 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, cold service”
Reviews.Author: tripplanet
Reviews.Content: Average, modest comfort. Very basic. Not very helpful staff. Small rooms and they ensured I leave within my check-out time by sending a reminder on the day early morning. Quite rude.

Reviews.Title: “Location wise, its great”
Reviews.Author: danvers
Reviews.Content: I went down with some co-workers last summer. We were attending the National Remolding Convention, and stayed at the Days Inn, which was literally right across the street. The owner of the company, stayed at "the hayet" also across the street. The staff at the hotel was incredibly helpful and patient with all of us checking in. My room was average on the cleanliness scale. The room did smell of smoke very bad tho. It was a smoking room, but it was like the windows had never been opened. Money wise, even tho it was a company trip and I didn't have to pay, i would not recommend staying here for any other reason other than the location. It's minutes away from the harbor area, which has tons of shops and restaurants. Its a crash hotel, one you go to just to sleep. I spent more time there than usual, do to the fact i was not yet of legal drinking age and everyone else in the office was. So poor old me got left behind most nights. Which reminds me, the bartender in the hotel bar was very nice. Im sure she still works there. If your going for the location, you should be all set. Just make sure to air the room out.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: snook3133
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several months ago with my girlfriend. We had decided to spend the weekend to celebrate our birthdays. The hotel itself is very nice as far as days inns go. It is several stories high, of red brick, with an adjacent attached parking garage. Baltimore can be very overwhelming if your not familiar with the area. However the staff were very friendly and provided good directions and a map. Nearby attractions include the aquarium, science center and several art museums. The bar/grill in the lobby was also very good. I would suggest trying the crab cakes or soup. During October the fells point festival was going on. Fells point is a nearby town/section of the inner harbor. Lots of bars, live music, cobblestone streets. I usually take a water taxi, to avoid traffic. It is definitely lots of fun. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: WildWestinAZ
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for business and this was my first time in Baltimore. I would not stay at this hotel again. The first night I stayed, my dinner (chicken) at the hotel restaurant was burnt, as was my travel companion’s hamburger. The waitress did not offer to refill our sodas until she brought the check. The front desk staff I interacted with were rude. When I inquired about restaurants in the area, I was told I could walk in any direction and find food. Not being familiar with the area (and I told her this), I ended up in an area of town that was very unsafe for two women. She could have directed me to the Harbor area that is beautiful and geared for tourists (tons of shops, eateries). For 24 hours, the hotel was without hot water. When I requested compensation, I was given a coupon for a free buffet breakfast (which had cold pancakes, undercooked bacon, and eggs I did not care for. They also had cold cereal and yogurt, buffet is normally $12). When I checked out, I found a $1.00 per day safe charge (which they begrudgingly removed) and a $0.50 per use fee to use an "800" calling card (this charge was not removed, but I do not recall this charge being advertised anywhere). Parking is not free. Housekeeping was satisfactory. The staff was pleasant but the floor didn't appear to ever get vacuumed. They did provide lots of towels and toiletries. The hotel is within walking distance to the baseball stadium, Baltimore aquarium, Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Second trip”
Reviews.Author: lewink
Reviews.Content: Overall, had a nice stay at this Day's Inn. The room was priced well ($109), and it has a great location. It is a Day's Inn, but it is clean, and has a great location. This is our second time staying there. If I had one problem, it was the lack of hot water on our second trip. They said it was because they were full due to bus loads of kids coming in the night before. Aren't hotels suppose to be full? We will stay again, but do hope the water is warmer in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great place downtown”
Reviews.Author: UofIx3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel during a conference at the end of March/beginning of April. Thought it was a great hotel. It's not ritzy, like many other conference hotels, but it was very clean, staff was very nice and the room (1st floor) was in great shape. Some positives: * You head out the front door, go a half block, cross the street and you're at the conference center! * Harbor is right past the conference center, so it's less than a five-minute walk. * free wireless Internet access - they also have a business center that includes free Interent access and printer (able to print out my boarding passes before heading to airport) * great access to public transportation - hotel is a block away from two stops on the light rail line to the airport; why pay $32 for a taxi, when you can pay $1.60 for a 30-minute trip to/from the airport There was another event with a large number of cheerleaders and I didn't hear them during my entire visit. All in all, I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Great Location - But.........................”
Reviews.Author: mechita
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, good food, location was good but, very noisy... trash is picked up at 6:30 am, extremely noisy. Room was clean and in order. Could not find a shower cap, very upasetting. They do not put enough of coffee supplies. The worst part was.... pillows! What are those???? they were not normal pillows, like everybody uses at home or in other hotels. There were three in each bed, small and extremely tall, all rolled up like sausages.... never seen nothing like it, so whenever you try to lay your head, it springs back! Please, I am sure you can put a couple of the normal pillows in the closet in case someone else prefers that style.... Good food for dinner and breakfast. The staff very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: kpepper
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through Expedia for New Years Eve. We were planning on going to the Ravens game and then an inner harbor cruise later that night. First of all, when we got to our room, we realized that we were put into a handicap room with a double bed. We had reserved a king size bed. We called down to get it changed and we told that the hotel was booked. It was nice that there was a safe in the room free to use. I thought that was one benefit since we had items that needed safe keeping. The bathroom shower was also quite nice with really good water pressure. Since it was a handicap room, the bathroom was bigger than most. In the morning they kept advertising their New Years breakfast. It was a buffet with complimentry champagne and pit beef. Not quite what you would want in the morning........even if you had been up all night celebrating the New Year. The buffet did have great food. It had a person making omelets but we decided not to get any because it was taking so long. When we finally got our bill, we were astounded. It was $20 a person! We were never informed of the price. While the food was good, it wasn't THAT good! I guess that champagne and pit beef wasn't really complimentry after all. All in all, I don't think that I would stay there again. While there was nothing wrong with it, it just seemed very overpriced for what it actually offered. There are much better hotels just a short distance away that charge half of what this hotel charged.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Boiler93
Reviews.Content: I decided to wait a month to write my review to see if my opinion would change. It hasn't. My family and I decided to stay a few days in Baltimore on our way back to NY from Dover DE. We had stayed in this Days Inn 2 years ago, and I'm pretty sure our recent stay in September 2006 will be our last stay there. The staff wasn't as friendly (except the restaurant, that staff was fantastic) and the rooms were run down. The rooms are small, there was wallpaper falling and the bathtub was not in the best condition. It's in a great location, so if you only are planning to stay a day or so for buisness or sightseeing it's okay. We had stayed at a competitor's hotel in DE and got a 1 bedroom, 2 Queen bed suite with a huge living room, kitchenette, bathroom and 2 televisions during a NASCAR weekend for $100 less. For the price we paid it definitely was not worth the value.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Inner Harbor
HotelInfo.Address: 100 Hopkins Place, Baltimore, MD 21201
